1162.description: Clarifies that any person that offers free or reduced rate shipping to a consumer in another state but who refuses to honor that shipping offer to a consumer in Hawaii has engaged in an act that is unfair and deceptive under certain conditions. Extends remedies.

1164.title: Relating To Principal Departments.
1164.description: Establishes repeal dates for each principal department, preceded by an auditor review. Establishes procedures for department termination.

1165.title: Relating To Renewable Energy Technologies Tax Credits.
1165.description: Amends the renewable energy technologies income tax credit to include commercial seawater air conditioning systems.

1166.title: Related To Firearms.
1166.description: Defines "assault rifle" and "assault shotgun". Amends the definition of "assault pistol" to expand what types of guns are considered assault pistols. Expands the ban on pistols with a detachable magazine with over ten round capacity to any firearm with a detachable magazine with over ten round capacity.

1167.title: Relating To Sentencing.
1167.description: Allows a defendant who has been convicted of three misdemeanors in Waikiki to be sentenced to a probationary term of geographic restriction not exceeding years during which the defendant shall be prohibited from entering Waikiki during the hours of 6:00 p.m. to 6:00 a.m. Imposes imprisonment of thirty days for violation.

1169.title: Relating To Hawaii's Environment.
1169.description: Establishes the Promise to Our Keiki Program in the Hawaii Tourism Authority to protect Hawaii endangered animals and natural and cultural resources from the impacts of tourism by initiatives that include educational videos on inbound flights, requiring passengers on inbound flights to sign Promise to Our Keiki Pledge forms, and educational cards on airplanes.

1170.title: Relating To The Uniform Information Practices Act.
1170.description: Includes the nonadministrative functions of the Judiciary in the definition of "agency" for purposes of the Uniform Information Practices Act. Allows persons to bring actions or make appeals under the Uniform Information Practices Act directly in the Supreme Court. Allows agencies to appeal decisions of the Office of Information Practices to the Supreme Court.

1172.title: Proposing Amendments To Article Vi Of The Constitution Of The State Of Hawaii To Amend The Manner In Which Justices And Judges Are Appointed, Consented To, And Retained.
1172.description: Proposes amendments to the Constitution of the State of Hawaii relating to the appointment and retention of justices and judges. Changes the required time frames from thirty to ninety days for the process to appoint and consent to a justice or judge. Harmonizes the senate consent procedures for district court judgeship nominees to mirror the senate consent procedures relating to supreme court justices and intermediate court of appeals and circuit court judges. Authorizes the senate to approve or reject subsequent terms of office for justices and judges.

1173.title: Relating To Electronic Prescription Accountability System.
1173.description: Amends section 329-104(c), Hawaii Revised Statutes, to allow the Department of Public Safety Narcotics Enforcement Division Administrator to disclose, at the Administrator's discretion, confidential information from the Electronic Prescription Accountability System, more commonly known as the Prescription Drug Monitoring Program, to authorized employees of the Department of Health Alcohol and Drug Abuse Division and the Emergency Medical Services and Injury Prevention Systems Branch.

1174.title: Relating To State Planning.
1174.description: Includes objectives and policies and implementation guidelines for planning for the lei of green in the Hawaii state plan.

1175.title: Proposing Amendments To Article Ix, Section 5, Of The Constitution Of The State Of Hawaii.
1175.description: Proposes an amendment to article IX, section 5, of the Constitution of the State of Hawaii, to require the State to assure that each resident of the State has access to housing, subject to standards and criteria to be provided by the Legislature. (HB1315 HD1)

1176.title: Relating To Condominium Voting.
1176.description: Provides for the use of an electronic voting device in condominium association meetings. Requires a condominium board to take reasonable steps to ensure secrecy and integrity of the votes, and that an audit trail be available after the meeting.

1178.title: Proposing An Amendment To The Hawaii Constitution To Transfer The Responsibility For The Provision Of Charter School Education From The State To The Counties.
1178.description: Proposes an amendment to the Constitution of the State of Hawaii to transfer the responsibility for the establishment, support, and control of charter schools from the State to the counties.

1180.title: Relating To The Issuance Of Special Purpose Revenue Bonds To Assist Seawater Air Conditioning Projects On Oahu.
1180.description: Extends the authorization to issue special purpose revenue bonds to assist Honolulu Seawater Air Conditioning, LLC, with the development of a seawater air-conditioning system in downtown Honolulu until June 30, 2024. (HB1321 HD1)

1181.title: Relating To Housing Production.
1181.description: Requires each county to authorize construction for a specified number of new housing units. Reduces the amount of transient accommodations tax revenue the counties receive for failure to meet the requirements. Allows for recoupment of reduction under certain circumstances. Repeals June 30, 2032.

1185.title: Relating To Water Rights.
1185.description: Allows for ten consecutive one-year holdovers of water permits under section 171-58(c), HRS. Makes conforming amendments to the reporting requirement in Act 126 (2016). Extends the repeal and reenactment provision for Act 126 (2016) by seven years, from June 30, 2019 to June 30, 2026. (HB1326 HD2)

1187.title: Relating To Government Websites.
1187.description: Requires that state and county websites be translated into the Hawaiian language. Appoints the Office of Planning to coordinate the translation. Appropriates funds. (HB1328 HD1)

1188.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Twenty-seventh Representative District.
1188.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 27th Representative District.

1189.title: Relating To The Budget Of The Department Of Commerce And Consumer Affairs.
1189.description: Appropriates funds for the fiscal biennium 2019-2021 operating budget of the Department of Commerce and Consumer Affairs financial services regulation program. (HB1330 HD1)

1192.title: Relating To The Department Of Public Safety Operating Budget.
1192.description: Relates to the Department of Public Safety budget. (HB1333 HD2)

1193.title: Relating To The Department Of Defense Operating Budget.
1193.description: Relates to the Department of Defense budget.

1194.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Forty-second Representative District.
1194.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the 42nd Representative District.

1195.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Fourteenth, Fifteenth, And Sixteenth Representative Districts.
1195.description: Authorizes issuance of general obligation bonds and appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 14th, 15th, and 16th Representative Districts.

1198.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Twentieth Representative District.
1198.description: Authorizes issuance of general obligation bonds and appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the 20th Representative District.

1199.title: Relating To Movie Theaters.
1199.description: Makes permanent the requirement for certain motion picture theater owners and operators to provide open movie captioning for at least two showings per week, one of which occurs on a Saturday or Sunday. Repeals the requirement to provide an option of personal closed captioning screenings by means of lightweight eyewear.

1201.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Thirty-third Representative District.
1201.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 33rd Representative District.

1203.title: Relating To The Department Of Human Resources Development Operating Budget.
1203.description: Appropriates funds for the operations of the Department of Human Resources Development. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD2)

1204.title: Relating To The Hawaii Employer Union Health Benefits Trust Fund Budget.
1204.description: Appropriates funds for the operating budget for the Employer Union Health Benefits Trust Fund for fiscal biennium 2019-2021. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

1208.title: Relating To Reserved Housing.
1208.description: Prohibits the Hawaii Community Development Authority from allowing satisfaction of a development project's affordable housing requirement through a cash payment in lieu of providing reserved housing. Effective 7/1/2075. (SD1)

1209.title: Relating To The Campaign Spending Commission Operating Budget.
1209.description: Provides funding for the operations of the Campaign Spending Commission for the fiscal biennium beginning July 1, 2019, and ending June 30, 2021. Effective 7/1/2030. (SD1)

1211.title: Relating To The Department Of The Attorney General Operating Budget.
1211.description: Transfers moneys from the DNA registry special fund to the medicaid investigations recovery fund. (SD1)

1212.title: Relating To The Office Of The Public Defender Operating Budget.
1212.description: Appropriates funds for the operating budget for the Office of the Public Defender for the fiscal biennium 2019-2021. Effective 7/1/2030. (SD1)

1213.title: Relating To The Office Of Information Practices Budget.
1213.description: Provides additional funding for the operations of the Office of Information Practices, including the establishment of three additional staff attorney positions, for the fiscal biennium beginning July 1, 2019, and ending June 30, 2021. Effective 7/1/2030. (SD1)

1214.title: Relating To The State Commission On The Status Of Women.
1214.description: Appropriates funds for operational expenses of the State Commission on the Status of Women. (HB1355 HD2)

1215.last_action: Received notice of all Senate conferees being discharged (Sen. Com. No. 535).
1215.title: Relating To The Office Of Elections Operating Budget.
1215.description: Appropriates funds to the Office of Elections operating budget for the 2020 election voting contract, 2021 reapportionment, and 4 temporary positions. (SD1)

1216.title: Relating To The Hawaii Civil Rights Commission Budget.
1216.description: Relates to the Hawaii Civil Rights Commission operating budget. (HB1357 HD1)

1217.title: Relating To Medicare Part B.
1217.description: Requires the board to send actual, individual notice via registered mail to EUTF members that they may be eligible for reimbursement of cost-adjusted Medicare Part B premium payments. (HB1358 HD1)

1218.title: Relating To Fiscal Biennium 2019-2021 Budget Requests For The Department Of Land And Natural Resources.
1218.description: Appropriates funds for the fiscal biennium 2019-2021 operating budget of the Department of Land and Natural Resources conveyances and recordings program. (SD1)

1219.last_action: Received notice of discharge of all House conferees (Hse. Com. No. 363).
1219.title: Relating To Fiscal Biennium 2019-2021 Budget Requests For The Department Of Commerce And Consumer Affairs.
1219.description: Appropriates funds for the fiscal biennium 2019-2021 operating budget of certain Department of Commerce and Consumer Affairs programs. Effective 7/1/2051. (SD1)

1220.title: Relating To Pharmacy Benefit Managers.
1220.description: Prohibits pharmacy benefit managers from engaging in self-serving business practices. Replaces registration requirement with license requirement for pharmacy benefit managers. Increases pharmacy benefit manager reporting requirements to the insurance commissioner.

1221.title: Relating To The Salary Of The Public Utilities Commissioners.
1221.description: Aligns the salary of the public utilities commission chair with the highest pay tier of a supervising deputy attorney general. Aligns the salary of the other PUC commissioners with the lowest pay tier of the first deputy attorney general.

1222.title: Relating To Nurses.
1222.description: Establishes a study to identify issues that may arise if the State joins the Nurse Licensure Compact. (HB1363 HD2)

1223.title: Relating To The Department Of Land And Natural Resources Budget.
1223.description: Appropriates funds for the operating budget for the Department of Land and Natural Resources for the fiscal biennium 2019-2021. (SD1)

1224.title: Relating To The Department Of Agriculture Budget.
1224.description: Appropriates funds for the operating budget for the Department of Agriculture for the fiscal biennium 2019-2021. (SD1)

1225.title: Relating To The Department Of Health Budget.
1225.description: Appropriates funds for the Department of Health for the fiscal biennium 2019-2021. (SD1)

1227.title: Relating To The Department Of Land And Natural Resources Operating Budget.
1227.description: Appropriates funds for the Department of Land and Natural Resources operating budget. (SD1)

1228.title: Relating To The Department Of Business, Economic Development, And Tourism Budget.
1228.description: Appropriates funds for the operating budget for the Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism for the fiscal biennium 2019-2021. (HB1369 HD1)

1229.title: Relating To Zero-emission Vehicles.
1229.description: Requires rental motor vehicle lessors to incorporate zero-emission vehicles into their fleets. Creates a rental motor vehicle emissions surcharge tax on rental motor vehicles with internal combustion engines. Creates a Hawaii zero-emissions vehicle infrastructure special fund and grant program to promote development of zero-emission vehicle infrastructure.

1230.title: Relating To The University Of Hawaii University Promise Program.
1230.description: Establishes the University of Hawaii University Promise Program to provide scholarships for the unmet direct cost needs of qualified students enrolled at any 4-year degree campus of the University of Hawaii system. Appropriates funds to establish and implement the program.

1231.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Thirteenth Representative District.
1231.description: Authorizes issuance of general obligation bonds and appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the 13th Representative District.

1232.title: Relating To The Hawaii Public Housing Authority Budget.
1232.description: Appropriates additional funds for the fiscal biennium 2019-2021 to the Hawaii Public Housing Authority to establish new positions and for operating costs for Rental Housing Services (HMS 220) and Rental Assistance Services (HMS 222). Effective 1/1/2050. (SD1)

1233.title: Relating To Department Of Accounting And General Services Capital Improvement Projects.
1233.description: Appropriates funds for a capital improvement project for the fiscal biennium beginning 7/1/2019, and ending 6/30/2021, for the State Foundation on Culture and the Arts. (HB1374 HD1)

1235.title: Relating To An Airports Corporation.
1235.description: Authorizes establishment of the Hawaii Airports Corporation within the Department of Transportation for administrative purposes. Sets out appointment of members to the board of directors and powers and duties of the Hawaii Airports Corporation. Transfers aeronautics functions of the Department of Transportation to the Hawaii Airports Corporation by the established transfer completion date agreed upon by the Hawaii Airports Corporation, the Director of Transportation, and the Governor, which shall be no later than 12/31/2022. Appropriates funds.

1241.title: Relating To Public Utility Infrastructure.
1241.description: Requires the public utilities commission to determine whether the implementation of a cost recovery and income generating mechanism of leasing unused fiber, conduit, and other infrastructure is in the public interest. Requires the public utilities commission to report on economic incentives, cost recovery mechanisms considered, and the financial impacts where implemented.

1242.title: Relating To The Hawaii Scientist-to-teacher Pathway Pilot Program.
1242.description: Requires the Department of Education to establish a 5-year Hawaii Scientist-to-Teacher Pathway Pilot Program to recruit, train, support, and retain qualified science, technology, engineering, and mathematics professionals as kindergarten through grade twelve teachers of those subjects in the State. Appropriates funds.

1243.title: Relating To Online Early Education.
1243.description: Establishes the online early learning program within the Department of Education. Appropriates moneys.

1244.title: Relating To The Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Thirty-sixth Representative District.
1244.description: Authorizes issuance of general obligation bonds and appropriates moneys for capital improvement projects in the 36th representative district.

1245.title: Relating To Jurors.
1245.description: Allows persons seventy years old or older to claim exemption from service as a juror.

1246.title: Relating To Leases.
1246.description: Requires leases used in the conveyance of available lands as defined by section 203 of the Hawaiian Homes Commission Act, as amended, to conform to the requirements for securitization by federally insured lending programs.

1247.title: Relating To Iolani Palace.
1247.description: Phases out parking of motor vehicles on the grounds of Iolani Palace. Requires DAGS to remove the blacktop, parking area, and parking meters adjacent to Iolani Palace. Requires DLNR to develop and maintain a pedestrian area adjacent to Iolani Palace. Requires DAGS and DLNR to report cost analysis to the legislature.

1248.title: Relating To Department Of Hawaiian Homelands.
1248.description: Establishes a task force to examine the current operation and practices of the Department of Hawaiian Homelands, particularly as it relates to use and distribution of its land assets, and to further provide suggestions and innovative solutions to end the waitlist issue and assist with initiatives designed to increase self-funding through better leveraging of assets.

1249.title: Relating To The Pueo.
1249.description: Conditions expenditures from the University of Hawaii real property and facilities use revolving fund on the University of Hawaii entering into a Habitat Conservation Plan to protect the pueo on the University of Hawaii West Oahu campus.

1250.title: Relating To Inspections.
1250.description: Requires the Department of Health to notify the operators of long-term care facilities of unannounced visits or inspections.

1251.last_action: Received notice of all Senate conferees being discharged (Sen. Com. No. 535).
1251.title: Relating To The County Surcharge On State Tax.
1251.description: Authorizes any county with a population equal to or less than 500,000 that adopts a county surcharge on state tax ordinance to use the surcharges received from the State for infrastructure and public safety. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

1253.title: Relating To Governmental Wheeling.
1253.description: Authorizes government agencies to engage in the wheeling of electricity that is produced at a government facility from renewable energy sources in order to power other government facilities.

1254.title: Relating To Residential Leaseholds.
1254.description: Amends the definition of "lot", "houselot", "residential lot", and "residential houselot" in section 516-1, HRS, by deleting the requirement that such parcels be zoned for residential use.

1255.title: Relating To Ahupuaa o Kahana State Park.
1255.description: Appropriates moneys to the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation for low-interest home construction and home improvement loans to holders of Ahupuaa O Kahana State Park residential leases. Closes the period during which loans may be granted on June 30, 2023.

1256.title: Relating To Vocational And Technical Education.
1256.description: Requires the DOE to establish a career and technology center program, to include career and technology centers for high school students on Oahu, Hawaii, Maui, and Kauai, and auxiliary centers on Lanai and Molokai. Requires the DOE to report to the 2019 legislature on the development and implementation of the program.

1259.last_action: The hearing on this measure has been cancelled until further notice.
1259.title: Relating To The Community-based Economic Development Program.
1259.description: Establishes the micro enterprise assistance program on Hawaiian home lands revolving fund to provide grants and loans through the implementation of the micro enterprise assistance program to qualified native Hawaiians, native Hawaiian-controlled homestead associations, and homestead association community development corporations. Appropriates funds. Takes effect on 7/1/2050. (SD1)

1263.title: Making An Appropriation For Iolani Palace.
1263.description: Appropriates funds for Iolani Palace's maintenance and operating costs. (HB1406 HD1)

1265.last_action: Received notice of discharge of all House conferees (Hse. Com. No. 363).
1265.title: Relating To The Hawaii Housing Finance And Development Corporation Budget.
1265.description: Establishes the Office of the Housing Advocate to work with all state agencies that manage land to advocate for solutions to the State's housing shortage, and monitor, comment, and report on the State's production of affordable housing units and the development and implementation of laws, regulations, and policies relating to affordable housing. Effective 1/1/2050. (SD2)

1266.title: Relating To Sustainable Business Corporations.
1266.description: Requires sustainable business corporations to file annual benefit reports with DCCA. Authorizes DCCA to terminate sustainable business corporation status for noncompliance. Requires the Business Registration Division to post searchable information on sustainable business corporations on its website. (HB1409 HD1)

1267.title: Relating To The Board Of Land And Natural Resources.
1267.description: Adds a member to the Board of Land and Natural Resources who has demonstrated knowledge of, and experience in, the State's boating and fishing communities. (HB1410 HD1)

1270.title: Relating To The Hawaii Labor Relations Board.
1270.description: Requires the Hawaii Labor Relations Board to determine qualifications for grievance arbitrators and interest arbitrators, and to review and determine qualifications and criteria for potential arbitrators to resolve collective bargaining impasses. (HB1414 HD1)

1271.title: Relating To Health Insurance.
1271.description: Requires the Department of Human Services to conduct a study on the need for the Hawaii Care Plan to provide health insurance for any individual who is not otherwise eligible for medicaid. (HB1415 HD1)

1273.title: Relating To United States Senator Daniel K. Inouye Day.
1273.description: Designates 9/7 of each year as United States Senator Daniel K. Inouye Day.

1274.title: Relating To United States Senator Daniel K. Akaka Day.
1274.description: Designates 9/11 of each year as United States Senator Daniel K. Akaka Day.

1277.title: Relating To The Department Of Health.
1277.description: Appropriates funds for the fiscal biennium 2019-2021 operating budget of the Department of Health programs under the purview of the House of Representatives Standing Committee on Health. (HB1422 HD2)

1278.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Thirty-ninth District Of The House Of Representatives.
1278.description: Appropriates funds to be expended by the Department of Education for the benefit of the 39th District of the House of Representatives.

1279.title: Relating To Visitor Information.
1279.description: Establishes a Visitor Information Center in the State Capitol. Appropriates funds. Takes effect 7/1/2022. (SD1)

1282.title: Relating To The Department Of Budget And Finance Budget.
1282.description: Provides funding for the operations of the Department of Budget and Finance for the fiscal biennium beginning July 1, 2019, and ending June 30, 2021. (HB1427 HD1)

1283.title: Relating To The Office Of The Governor Budget.
1283.description: Appropriates funds for the operating budget for the Office of the Governor for the fiscal biennium 2019-2021. (HB1428 HD1)

1284.title: Relating To The Budget Of The Office Of The Governor.
1284.description: Appropriates funds for the Fiscal Biennium 2019-2021 Operating Budget of the Office of the Governor. (HB1429 HD1)

1285.title: Relating To The Budget Of The Office Of The Lieutenant Governor.
1285.description: Appropriates funds for the Fiscal Biennium 2019-2021 Operating Budget of the Office of the Lieutenant Governor. (HB1430 HD1)

1287.title: Relating To The Budget Of The Department Of Accounting And General Services.
1287.description: Appropriates funds for the fiscal biennium 2019-2021 operating budget of certain programs of the Department of Accounting and General Services programs under the purview of the House of Representatives Standing Committee on Legislative Management. (HB1432 HD1)

1288.title: Relating To Advanced Practice Registered Nurses.
1288.description: Authorizes advanced practice registered nurses to provide abortions. Clarifies who may refuse to perform an abortion and notice procedures for refusal. Authorizes the board of nursing to adopt interim rules.

1290.title: Relating To Pretrial Release.
1290.description: Requires courts to order any person charged with a criminal offense to be released on personal recognizance or on the execution of an unsecured bond, unless the person is unlikely to appear for trial. Requires the Judiciary to establish statewide court appearance reminder system. (HB1436 HD1)

1291.title: Making An Appropriation For Schools In The Nanakuli-waianae Complex Area.
1291.description: Appropriates funds for schools in the Nanakuli-Waianae Complex Area for capital improvement projects to install, repair, and maintain air conditioning in those schools.

1292.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Forty-fourth Representative District.
1292.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 44th Representative District.

1293.title: Relating To Water Circulation.
1293.description: Requires the Department of Land and Natural Resources to collaborate with various agencies to research and develop a mechanism for increased water circulation in Pokai Bay.

1294.title: Relating To Former President Barack Obama.
1294.description: Establishes a temporary commission to develop and implement initiatives recognizing former President Barack Obama, his historic legacy, and his impact on the State.

1295.title: Relating To Medical Cannabis Products.
1295.description: Updates transdermal patches to transdermal devices in section 329D-10, Hawaii Revised Statutes, thereby including non-patch devices that deliver through the dermis.

1297.title: Relating To Drug Disposal.
1297.description: Permits hospitals and clinics with on-site pharmacies, retail pharmacies, and law enforcement agencies to install and maintain take-back collection receptacles for controlled substances.

1300.title: Relating To The Makiki Public Library.
1300.description: Appropriates funds to the department of education for the planning, design, and construction of, and equipment for, a bookmobile facility in Makiki.

1306.title: Relating To An Earned Income Disregard Program.
1306.description: Requires the department of human services to implement an earned income disregard program as an intermediate step to implementing a medicaid buy-in program. Requires reports to the legislature. Takes effect upon approval by the governor and Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services.

1307.title: Relating To The Maui Food Innovation Center.
1307.description: Appropriates funds to the UH Maui College Maui Food Innovation Center for three permanent faculty positions and instructional supplies.

1308.title: Relating To Transit Oriented Development.
1308.description: Appropriates funds to the Office of Planning for the planning and development of the Wailuku-Kahului Transit Corridor Master Plan in the county of Maui. Effective 7/1/2100. (SD1)

1311.title: Relating To The Statewide Boating Program.
1311.description: Defines "state boating facility" to include any day-use mooring buoy system. Authorizes funds from the Boating Special Fund to be used for any day-use mooring buoy system in the State. (HB1460 HD1)

1312.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Seventh Representative District.
1312.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 7th Representative District.

1313.title: Relating To Unfunded Liabilities.
1313.description: Requires the State Auditor to study the feasibility of providing health benefits to state and county employees using a self-insured model. Appropriates funds. Establishes the Rate Stabilization Reserve Fund. Caps employer contributions to the Other Post-Employment Benefits Trust Fund. Provides for the use of a portion of TAT revenues to supplement deficient county public employer contribution amounts. (HB1462 HD1)

1314.title: Relating To Delay In Prior Approval For Medical Services.
1314.description: Exempts health care providers from civil liability in the case of the provider's patient receiving any injury or worsening of a health condition while awaiting insurer preauthorization for medical services or treatment.

1316.title: Relating To Public Schools.
1316.description: Appropriates funds to be used by the Department of Education for the repair and maintenance of public school buildings, grounds, and facilities in the State. (HB1465 HD2)

1319.last_action: Received notice of discharge of all House conferees (Hse. Com. No. 363).
1319.title: Relating To The Waianae Coast Comprehensive Health Center.
1319.description: Appropriates moneys to the Department of Health to provide the Waianae Coast Comprehensive Health Center with funding for an advanced practice registered nurse position and various infrastructure improvements for its school-based health center at Nanakuli High and Intermediate School. Takes effect 7/1/2050. (SD1)

1320.title: Relating To The College Savings Program.
1320.description: Establishes a state income tax deduction for eligible contributions made to any college savings program under section 529 of the Internal Revenue Code. Applies to taxable years beginning after 12/31/2020. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD2)

1322.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Forty-third Representative District.
1322.description: Authorizes issuance of general obligation bonds and appropriates funds for capital improvement projects in the 43rd Representative District.

1324.title: Relating To Electric Guns.
1324.description: Repeals the ban on electric guns. Establishes a regulatory structure for the sale and transfer of electric guns by licensed persons. Restricts the use, storage, transfer, and disposal of electric guns. Requires training and education on electric guns. Prohibits certain individuals from possessing and using electric guns. Prohibits the use of electric guns in the commission of crimes.

1327.title: Proposing An Amendment To Article I Of The Constitution Of The State Of Hawaii Relating To The Rights Of Victims Of Crime.
1327.description: Proposes an amendment to the Hawaii State Constitution to provide victims of crime with specific rights related to the criminal justice process.

1331.title: Relating To Tax Credits.
1331.description: Increases the allowable income tax credit for low-income household renters to an unspecified amount. Makes the earned income tax credit refundable for ten taxable years beginning after 12/31/2019. Increases the allowable amount of the refundable food/excise tax credit to an unspecified amount.

1332.title: Relating To Agricultural Loans.
1332.description: Establishes a five-year pilot program within the Department of Agriculture for agricultural loans that do not incur interest or require payments for three years. (HB1481 HD1)

1333.title: Proposing Amendments To Article Xi Of The Hawaii Constitution To Promote The Conservation And Protection Of The State's Beach Resources.
1333.description: Proposes amendments to the Constitution of the State of Hawaii to permit the State to manage beach resources statewide and in perpetuity.

1334.title: Relating To Climate Change.
1334.description: Amends the Greenhouse Gas Sequestration Task Force nomination and appointment process. Appropriates funds to the Office of Planning to administer the Greenhouse Gas Sequestration Task Force. (SD1)

1337.title: Relating To Guns.
1337.description: Requires an applicant to successfully complete a firearms safety or training course within thirty days before applying for or renewing a license to carry a concealed or unconcealed weapon. Repeals the ban on electric guns.

1340.title: Relating To The Compact Of Free Association.
1340.description: Exempts citizens from countries having a valid Compact of Free Association with the United States from the requirement that a driver's license expire no later than the person's authorized period of stay in the United States. Requires the person to provide proof of legal presence.

1343.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For President Theodore Roosevelt High School.
1343.description: Authorizes issuance of GO bonds to finance plans, design, construction, and equipment for new music facilities at President Roosevelt high school.

1345.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Twenty-third House Of Representatives District.
1345.description: Authorizes issuance of general obligation bonds and appropriates funds for a capital improvement project for the benefit of Manoa elementary school in the 23rd Representative District.

1346.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Twenty-third Representative District.
1346.description: Authorizes issuance of general obligation bonds and appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 23rd Representative District.

1348.title: Relating To The Hawaii Community Development Authority.
1348.description: Establishes the Stadium Development District comprising all state land under the Stadium Authority's jurisdiction. Authorizes HCDA to facilitate the development of all state property within the District including building a new stadium. Authorizes the issuance of revenue bonds and general obligation bonds. Appropriates funds. Effective 1/1/2050. (SD1)

1350.title: Relating To Criminal Trespass.
1350.description: Requires county police officers to remove criminal trespassers from state lands upon request from state departments and agencies.

1351.title: Relating To County Zoning.
1351.description: Limits the counties' authority to grant variances or exceptions to zoning ordinances and to waive or discount any fine or monetary penalty for violation of zoning ordinances. Limits judicial remedy for fines or penalties. Requires strict construction of zoning ordinances and county general plans.

1352.title: Relating To Molokai Ranch.
1352.description: Appropriates moneys for the acquisition of Molokai Ranch. Requires that lands acquired pursuant to this Act be held in the public land trust.

1360.title: Relating To Cigarettes.
1360.description: Progressively bans the sale of cigarettes by raising the minimum age of persons to whom cigarettes may be legally sold to 30 years of age in 2020, 40 years of age in 2021, 50 years of age in 2022, 60 years of age in 2023, and then 100 years of age in 2024.

1361.title: Relating To Agricultural Villages.
1361.description: Authorizes an applicable county planning commission to issue special permits for agricultural villages without approval from the Land Use Commission.

1362.title: Relating To The Community-based Economic Development Advisory Council.
1362.description: Requires the Community-Based Economic Development Advisory Council to retain and oversee professional research and analysis services for the evaluation of the means for or barriers to private for-profit start-up agricultural businesses to acquire funds for agriculture infrastructure projects. (HB1511 HD2)

1363.title: Relating To Liquor Commissions.
1363.description: Prohibits liquor commissions from creating or enforcing rules that relate to certain moral issues or sexual conduct. Requires that the term of any certificate of registration for a dancer employed by a liquor licensee be for the same length of time as any other employee of the licensee. Excludes lap dancing performed by a dancer registered with a liquor commission and performed on authorized liquor licensee premises from the offense of prostitution.

1369.title: Relating To Motions To Vacate Convictions For Prostitution-related Offenses.
1369.description: Allows a defendant convicted of one of certain prostitution offenses to file a motion to vacate the conviction if the defendant is not subsequently convicted of any offense under the penal code within twelve months after the date of the original conviction. Repeals provisions allowing a motion to vacate when the convicted person was a victim of trafficking, and related procedural requirements.

1372.title: Relating To The University Of Hawaii Budget.
1372.description: Appropriates funds for the fiscal biennium 2019-2021 operating budget of the University of Hawaii under the purview of the House of Representatives Standing Committee on Lower and Higher Education. (HB1521 HD1)

1374.last_action: Notice of Intent to veto dated 08-31-20 (Gov. Msg. No. 1119)
1374.title: Relating To The Department Of Education Budget.
1374.description: Specifies that the costs of devices for certain Department of Education schools shall be covered using Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act (CARES Act) funds. (SD2)

1376.title: Relating To The Hawaii State Public Library System Budget.
1376.description: Appropriates funds for the fiscal biennium 2019-2021 operating budget of the Hawaii State Public Library System. Effective 7/1/2055. (SD1)

1377.title: Relating To The State Public Charter Schools Budget.
1377.description: Appropriates funds for the fiscal biennium 2019-2021 operating budget for Department of Education programs relating to charter schools. Effective 7/1/2055. (SD1)

1378.title: Relating To The Executive Office On Early Learning Budget.
1378.description: Appropriates funds for the fiscal biennium 2019-2021 operating budget of the Department of Education's Executive Office on Early Learning program. (SD2)

1379.title: Relating To Commerce And Consumer Affairs.
1379.description: Repeals the existing statutory requirement that $2,000,000 of certain taxes collected on bank and financial corporations be deposited to the compliance resolution fund. Requires adjustments to fees and assessments collected by the Division of Financial Institutions based on the amount of moneys credited to the division in the compliance resolution fund. Establishes criteria to determine the amounts to be assessed for fees and expenses regulated under title 25, HRS. Provides for the reduction or cessation of fees or interest paid into the mortgage loan recovery fund, contractors recovery fund, contractors education fund, real estate recovery fund, real estate education fund, and condominium education fund if the balance in the funds attain a certain dollar amount. Sets the annual fee assessed on cable operators at 4.5% of the income received from subscribers for cable services rendered during the preceding calendar year. Authorizes the Director of the Department of Commerce and Consumer Affairs to reduce the fee if the amount exceeds the amount necessary to administer chapter 440G, HRS. (HB1528 HD1)

1380.last_action: The committee on JDC deferred the measure.
1380.title: Relating To Student Journalists.
1380.description: Allows student journalists at public schools to exercise freedom of speech and freedom of the press in school-sponsored media. Takes effect on 7/1/2055. (SD1)

1383.last_action: Received notice of discharge of all House conferees (Hse. Com. No. 363).
1383.title: Relating To Administrative Procedures.
1383.description: Allows the Hawaii Labor Relations Board to admit and consider hearsay evidence in unfair labor practices proceedings. Effective 1/1/2050. (SD1)

1384.last_action: Received notice of discharge of all House conferees (Hse. Com. No. 363).
1384.title: Relating To Historic Preservation.
1384.description: Establishes a historic preservation income tax credit. Appropriates funds for one temporary position to assist with the establishment and administration of the historic preservation income tax credit program. Effective on 1/1/2020. (SD1)

1386.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Kunoa Cattle Company.
1386.description: Appropriates $400,000 for a capital improvement project for Kunoa Cattle Company.

1388.title: Relating To The Office Of Mauna Kea Management.
1388.description: Appropriates funds to the University of Hawaii for an unspecified number of FTE positions within the Office of Mauna Kea Management. (HB1537 HD1)

1389.title: Relating To Dams And Reservoirs.
1389.description: Establishes standards for the permitting, inspection, and maintenance of dams, reservoirs, and their appurtenant structures. Establishes the dam rehabilitation loan revolving fund and loan program. Authorizes the issuance of revenue bonds to fund the dam rehabilitation loan program.

1391.title: Relating To University Of Hawaii Scholarships.
1391.description: Establishes the Hawaii travel industry management promise program to provide scholarships to certain community college graduates enrolled in the bachelor of science program of the University of Hawaii at Manoa, School of Travel Industry Management.

1392.last_action: Received notice of discharge of all House conferees (Hse. Com. No. 363).
1392.title: Relating To Gun Violence Prevention.
1392.description: Establishes the Hawaii Gun Violence Prevention Center within the University of Hawaii to research strategies to prevent gun violence. Creates a special fund to support the Center. Appropriates funds. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

1394.title: Relating To Gun Violence Protective Orders.
1394.description: Establishes a process allowing law enforcement officers and family or household members to obtain a court order to prevent a person from accessing firearms and ammunition where the person poses a danger of causing bodily injury to oneself or another.

1399.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Second Representative District.
1399.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 2nd Representative District.

1401.last_action: The hearing on this measure has been cancelled until further notice.
1401.title: Relating To Homeland Security.
1401.description: Establishes the Hawaii State Fusion Center as a program under the Office of Homeland Security and establishes the state-funded position of Hawaii State Fusion Center Director to manage the Center's day-to-day operations and be accountable to the Director of Homeland Security. Effective 1/28/2081. (SD1)

1402.title: Relating To The Department Of Human Services Operating Budget.
1402.description: Relates to the Department of Human Services operating budget. Takes effect 7/1/2030. (SD1)

1403.title: Relating To Social Media.
1403.description: Establishes a task force to study the uses of social media platforms in the legislative process.

1405.title: Relating To Unoccupied Residential Properties.
1405.description: Imposes fines on a homeowner, foreclosing party, or prevailing purchaser in foreclosure actions when a vacant residential property subject to foreclosure remains unoccupied during the foreclosure process. Establishes conditions under which a property may be rented. (HB1557 HD1)

1406.title: Relating To The Kakaako Community Development District.
1406.description: Authorizes the HCDA to permit one building that is up to 768 feet in height and located near a transit station within each approved master plan area for the Kakaako Mauka area of the Kakaako Community Development District, subject to provision of appropriate public benefits. (HB1559 HD1)

1408.last_action: Received notice of discharge of all House conferees (Hse. Com. No. 363).
1408.title: Relating To The Department Of Agriculture Operating Budget.
1408.description: Makes appropriations relating to the Department of Agriculture operating budget. (SD2)

1410.title: Relating To Coastal Zone Management.
1410.description: Establishes the Hawaii Beach Preservation Revolving Fund within the State Treasury. Establishes a low-interest Contingent Mortgage Financing Pilot Program to encourage certain shoreline property owners to relocate mauka of expected sea level rise and erosion hazard zones. Amends coastal zone management laws to further protect against impacts of sea level rise and coastal erosion. Appropriates funds. (HB1564 HD1)

1411.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Tenth Representative District.
1411.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 10th Representative District.

1412.title: Relating To Prescriptive Authority For Certain Clinical Psychologists.
1412.description: Authorizes and establishes procedures and criteria for prescriptive authority for clinical psychologists who meet specific education, training, and registration requirements. Requires the Board of Psychology to report to the Legislature prior to the Regular Session of 2021. Sunsets on 8/31/2025. (HB1566 HD1)

1415.title: Relating To The Habitat Conservation Preserve.
1415.description: Requires the University of Hawaii to establish a habitat conservation preserve at its West Oahu campus.

1416.title: Relating To Pedestrian Safety In Crosswalks.
1416.description: Requires the department of transportation to establish a policy that prioritizes improvements to crosswalks located in areas with frequent pedestrian injuries and fatalities and considers installing additional safety features.

1417.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Seventeenth Representative District.
1417.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 17th Representative District.

1418.title: Relating To The Hawaii Commercial Harbors Authority.
1418.description: Establishes the Hawaii Commercial Harbors Authority. Transfers jurisdiction and functions relating to commercial harbors and commercial maritime operations from the Department of Transportation to the Hawaii Commercial Harbors Authority. Appropriates funds.

1420.title: Relating To Electronic Smoking Products.
1420.description: Establishes the offense of unlawful shipment of e-liquid products. Includes e-liquid within the definition of "tobacco products", as used in the cigarette tax and tobacco tax law. Increases the license fee for persons engaged as a wholesaler or dealer of cigarettes and tobacco products. Increases the retail tobacco permit fee for retailers engaged in the retail sale of cigarettes and tobacco products. Allocates a portion of collected excise taxes on tobacco products to the Tobacco Prevention and Control Trust Fund. Repeals certain provisions of the Hawaii Revised Statutes relating to electronic smoking devices. (HB1574 HD2)

1422.title: Relating To Solid Waste.
1422.description: Requires a retailer of certain batteries to implement a program in which the retailer accepts used batteries for reuse, recycling, or other means of disposal. Requires the Department of Health to expand its recycling operations to accommodate the recycling of batteries. Appropriates moneys.

1423.title: Relating To Detector-dogs.
1423.description: Appropriates funds for detector-dogs for the State's biosecurity program. Authorizes and funds a pilot program using dogs to detect fireworks in inbound cargo from state harbors and inter-island transport.

1425.title: Relating To Statewide Sustainability Initiatives.
1425.description: Imposes a tax of $15 for every ton of carbon dioxide emitted from the use of fossil fuel. Establishes various state and county sustainability initiatives. Appropriates moneys.

1428.last_action: Received notice of discharge of all House conferees (Hse. Com. No. 363).
1428.title: Relating To Concessions On Public Property.
1428.description: Increases the maximum length of concession contracts from 15 years to 20 years. Replaces requirements that certain concessions shall be operated by nonprofit corporations in order to be exempt from the sealed bid requirements of section 102-2(a), Hawaii Revised Statutes, with a requirement that state and county agencies give preference to nonprofit corporations pursuant to rules. Provides that a county director of parks and recreation shall designate which county zoos, botanic gardens, or other county parks are environmentally, culturally, historically, or operationally unique for the purpose of determining whether a concession at the zoo, botanic garden, or other park is exempt from the sealed bid requirements of section 102-2(a), Hawaii Revised Statutes. Exempts from sealed bid requirements of section 102-2(a), Hawaii Revised Statutes, concessions on public property whose operations provide historical and cultural information, goods, and services within the Hawaii Capital Historic District. Takes effect 7/1/2050. (SD2)

1430.title: Relating To Carbon Emissions.
1430.description: Appropriates funds to the Office of Planning to conduct a comprehensive study of a statewide carbon tax. Effective 7/1/2100. (SD1)

1431.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Eighteenth Representative District.
1431.description: Authorizes issuance of general obligation bonds and appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 18th Representative District.

1433.title: Proposing Amendments To The Constitution Regarding The Election Of State Officials.
1433.description: Provides that if there are 2 or more candidates for a state public office, and a candidate receives the majority of votes for that office in the primary election, that candidate shall be elected. Provides that if none of the candidates receives a majority of votes cast in a primary election for a state public office, the 2 candidates who receive the highest number of votes for that office shall advance to a general election. Repeals constitutional requirements that a candidate for lieutenant governor be elected at the same time and on the same party ticket as a candidate for governor.

1434.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Forty-fifth Representative District.
1434.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 45th Representative District.

1435.title: Relating To Taxes.
1435.description: Eliminates the individual income tax for single filers and heads of households making less than $20,000 or joint filers making less than $40,000 and increases the income tax rate more slowly for low- and medium-income filers. Increases the general excise tax by 0.15 percent, the transient accommodations tax by 0.50 percent, the liquor tax, and the cigarette and tobacco tax.

1437.last_action: Received notice of discharge of all House conferees (Hse. Com. No. 363).
1437.title: Relating To Information Technology.
1437.description: Requires the department of education, in consultation with the office of enterprise technology services, to develop and procure a uniform financial database, with parameters, benefits, and features that are compatible to the software system being implemented by the office of enterprise technology services for use by all state agencies. Appropriates moneys. Takes effect on 7/1/2112. (SD1)

1438.title: Relating To Licensed Crisis Residential Shelters.
1438.description: Appropriates funds to increase the number of residential beds available for those experiencing mental health crisis. Gives the department of health the funds to expand these programs to all counties.

1439.title: Relating To Gender Equality.
1439.description: Establishes the advisory commission on gender equity in sports to evaluate the rules and procedures for gender equity enforcement mechanisms and make recommendations to the Department of Education. Requires the Superintendent of Education to submit a Title IX compliance report to the Legislature and the advisory commission.

1440.title: Relating To Substitute Caregivers.
1440.description: Authorizes certain substitute caregivers in certain care facilities to serve in that capacity for a maximum of 6 hours per day.

1446.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to JDC.
1446.title: Relating To Human Remains.
1446.description: Includes the use of natural organic reduction as a method for the disposal of human remains. Amends the procedures for the resolution of disputes regarding the right of disposition, the right to rely and act upon written instructions in a funeral service agreement or similar document, and provisions for the disposition of a decedent's remains and recovery of reasonable expenses to include natural organic reduction facilities. Establishes a working group to explore natural organic reduction as a means of disposal of human remains. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

1449.last_action: The committee(s) on LAB recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1449.title: Relating To Service Charges.
1449.description: Prohibits restaurants and hotels from applying service charges for the sale of food or beverage services unless they are distributed as tip income directly to their employees.

1450.title: Relating To Professional And Vocational Licensure.
1450.description: Specifies the documentation needed for a military spouse to receive a temporary licensure by endorsement. Requires issuance of the license within an unspecified number of days of the application and supporting documents. Excludes construction contracting services form the performance of services permitted under any license or temporary license issues to a military spouse. Requires each licensing board to adopt and publish rules by 8/1/2020 to administer the provisions. Takes effect on 1/1/2050. (HD1)

1454.last_action: Re-referred to EDB, CPC/JUD, FIN, referral sheet 9
1454.title: Relating To An Interstate Compact To Phase Out Corporate Welfare.
1454.description: Adopts the Interstate Compact to Phase Out Corporate Welfare.

1455.last_action: Referred to EEP/WLH, FIN, referral sheet 1
1455.title: Relating To Shorelines.
1455.description: Authorizes the Board of Land and Natural Resources to provide shoreline encroachment easements that do not exceed 10 years to landowners having structures that encroach on the shoreline. Requires the Board of Land and Natural Resources to adopt rules that establish a policy and procedure for the granting or renewal of shoreline encroachment easements. Requires the adopted policy to consider the impact of expected sea level rise on the encroaching structures. Prohibits the granting of any new shoreline encroachment easements until the new policy is adopted.

1460.last_action: The committee(s) on PVM recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1460.title: Relating To Parole Officers.
1460.description: Gives parole officers, within the scope of their duty, the powers of a police officers. Provides parole officers with the authority to arrest paroled prisoners without a warrant when there is probable cause of a violation of parole. Authorizes parole officers to use electric guns and subjects parole officers to the authority of the law enforcement standards board.

1462.last_action: Referred to AGR, JUD, referral sheet 1
1462.title: Relating To The Sexual Assault Of An Animal.
1462.description: Amends the Penal Code to establish the crime of sexual assault of an animal. Provides that the sexual assault of an animal is a class C felony or a class B felony if the offense subjects a minor to sexual contact with an animal or is committed in the presence of a minor.

1463.last_action: The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1463.title: Relating To Penal Responsibility.
1463.description: Authorizes the courts to enter into agreements to divert into residential, rehabilitative, and other treatment those defendants whose physical or mental disease, disorder, or defect is believed to have become or will become an issue in a judicial case. Requires either one psychiatrist or one psychologist to be appointed in felony cases requiring three examiners. Requires an examination for penal responsibility to be conducted within fifteen days after a finding of fitness to proceed. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

1464.title: Relating To The Administration Of Justice.
1464.description: Amends the effect of finding a defendant charged with a petty misdemeanor not involving violence or attempted violence unfit to proceed. Amends the requirements for fitness determination hearings, court-appointed examiners, and examination reports. Authorizes the courts to enter into agreements to divert into residential, rehabilitative, and other treatment those defendants whose physical or mental disease, disorder, or defect is believed to have become or will become an issue in a judicial case. Amends the requirements for appointing qualified examiners to perform examinations for penal responsibility. Removes the time requirement for the ordering of the penal responsibility evaluation. Requires the judiciary, in consultation with county prosecutors, to report to the Legislature on the effectiveness of the Act in 2021, 2022, and 2023. (SD2)

1475.last_action: Vetoed on 06-22-20 - Returned from the Governor without approval (Gov. Msg. No. 1102).
1475.title: Relating To State Bonds.
1475.description: Authorizes issuance of general obligation bonds. Authorizes issuance of instruments of indebtedness in an amount that may be necessary to finance any permitted purpose under the House Bill No. 2200, H.D. 1, S.D. 1 and section 13(3) of the Federal Reserve Act. Makes findings required by article VII, section 13, of the state constitution regarding the issuance of authorized bonds and the debt limit. (HB1631 SD1)

1477.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to WAM.
1477.title: Relating To Auditory Devices.
1477.description: Exempts gross receipts from the sale of auditory devices, such as hearing aids, from the general excise tax. Amends the definition of "prosthetic device" to include hearing aids and devices worn on the body. Exempts gross receipts from the repair of prosthetic devices from the general excise tax. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

1480.last_action: The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1480.title: Relating To Offenses Against Vulnerable Persons.
1480.description: Adds the acts of killing or inflicting serious or substantial bodily injury upon a pregnant woman in the course of committing or attempting to commit a felony, to the offenses for which a person is subject to an extended or mandatory minimum term of imprisonment.

1482.last_action: The committee(s) on HLT recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1482.title: Relating To Discharge Planning.
1482.description: Requires hospitals to provide patients or their designated caregiver with information on hospice and palliative care, if deemed relevant, upon discharge.

1484.title: Relating To Gun Violence.
1484.description: Short form bill relating to gun violence.

1487.title: Relating To Penalties.
1487.description: Short form bill relating to penalties.

1494.title: Relating To Sexual Assault Evidence Collection Kits.
1494.description: Extends the deadline for the counties to adopt and utilize electronic tracking systems for sexual assault evidence collection kits. Takes effect on July 1, 2050. (HD1)

1495.last_action: Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 417).
1495.title: Relating To Vehicle Inspections.
1495.description: Codifies certain certification, renewal, and violation processes of vehicle inspectors who conduct vehicle safety inspections under the DOT. Repeals section 286-85, HRS, which requires reconstructed vehicles to obtain a special inspection and certification. Takes effect on approval. (SD1)

1496.last_action: Referred to LAB, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 1
1496.title: Relating To Caregiving.
1496.description: Requires certain employers to provide employees with 12 months of paid caregiving leave during any calendar year to care for the employee's spouse, civil union partner, reciprocal beneficiary, significant other, relative, friend, or neighbor.

1497.last_action: The committee(s) on CPC recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1497.title: Relating To Residential Real Property.
1497.description: Establishes the time of transfer individual wastewater system inspection program to oversee the inspection and repair of any individual wastewater system at the time of sale or transfer of residential real property attached to the wastewater system. Excludes certain sales or transfers. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

1512.last_action: The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1512.title: Relating To Ballot Harvesting.
1512.description: Clarifies that only a designated agent can deliver a ballot on behalf of another. Prohibits ballot harvesting. Violators will be punishable under felony voter fraud statutes.

1515.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Third Representative District.
1515.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects in the third representative district.

1517.title: Relating To The State Ethics Code.
1517.description: Clarifies that the Hawaii State Ethics Commission and each house of the legislature shall adopt rules regarding disclosure of the nature and extent of any interest or transaction that the legislator believes may be affected by the legislator's official action. (SD1)

1518.last_action: The committee(s) on CPC recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1518.title: Relating To Secondhand Dealers.
1518.description: Clarifies that the secondhand dealers law applies to a secondhand dealer's operation of an automated recycling kiosk.

1519.last_action: Referred to WLH, FIN, referral sheet 1
1519.title: Relating To Wildlife.
1519.description: Establishes the wildlife conservation special fund to maintain a response to oiled wildlife and preserve and enhance wildlife habitation under threat from sea level rise associated with climate change. Allocates a portion of environmental response, energy, and food security tax revenues to the special fund.

1522.title: Relating To Musical Performances.
1522.description: Prohibits a person from advertising or conducting a live musical performance or production through the use of a deceptive affiliation under certain conditions. Enables action against deceptive practices by imposing penalties and private right of action. (SD1)

1524.title: Relating To Enhanced 911 Services.
1524.description: Establishes a prepaid wireless E911 surcharge to be imposed on prepaid wireless telecommunications services purchased at a retail transaction. Allows sellers to deduct and retain three per cent of the surcharge for administrative expenses. Requires deposit of the surcharge balance into the enhanced 911 fund. Beginning 7/1/2021, amends the enhanced 911 surcharge rate. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD2)

1526.last_action: Referred to LHE, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 1
1526.title: Relating To Intercollegiate Athletics.
1526.description: Authorizes a student-athlete to enter into a contract providing compensation to the student-athlete for use of the student-athlete's name, image, or likeness. Establishes various provisions prohibiting schools, athletic associations, and conferences from discriminating against student-athletes who receive compensation. Effective 1/1/2021.

1527.last_action: Referred to LAB, LHE, FIN, referral sheet 1
1527.title: Relating To Apprenticeships.
1527.description: Requires DLIR to develop and implement a high school apprenticeship program in public and charter schools with grades nine through twelve. Requires the DOE and DCCA to assist and support DLIR. Requires annual progress reports to the Legislature. Makes an appropriation.

1528.last_action: The committee(s) on EEP recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1528.title: Relating To Solid Waste Management.
1528.description: Establishes the solid waste management research and development special fund. Sets aside 1% of general revenues collected by the State each fiscal year to be deposited into the solid waste management research and development special fund. Requires the Department of Health to use moneys in the solid waste management research and development special fund for research and development into solid waste management. Requires the department to submit biennial reports to the Legislature.

1530.last_action: Re-referred to EEP/WLH, FIN, referral sheet 7
1530.title: Relating To Sustaining Hawaii.
1530.description: Requires that 1% of all assessments, fees, fines, penalties, reimbursements, and taxes collected by the Insurance Division be deposited into a special fund in the Department of Land and Natural Resources to be used for countermeasures against climate change.

1531.last_action: Referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 1
1531.title: Relating To Restroom Facilities.
1531.description: Requires that restrooms and toilet facilities of public amusement facilities constructed, renovated, or installed after 1/1/21 have two female-use toilets for each male-use toilet or urinal.

1532.last_action: Referred to WLH, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 1
1532.title: Relating To The Ala Wai Boat Harbor.
1532.description: Requires the Board of Land and Natural Resources to offer to sell leasehold condominium boat slips at the Ala Wai boat harbor to certain tenants of the harbor and allocate the proceeds of these sales for deferred maintenance of the harbor. Allows for the establishment of a condominium association at Ala Wai boat harbor to serve as the landlord of all boat slips at the harbor. Exempts owners of leasehold condominium boat slips at the Ala Wai boat harbor from moorage fees.

1533.title: Relating To Animal Fur Products.
1533.description: Prohibits the manufacture and sale of animal fur products, with certain exceptions. Takes effect on 7/1/2050. (HD1)

1538.last_action: Re-referred to EEP/LHE, FIN, referral sheet 14
1538.title: Relating To Heat Abatement.
1538.description: Expands authorized expenditures from the Hawaii green infrastructure special fund to include energy-efficient air conditioning. Appropriates funds and authorizes the department of education to borrow funds from the green infrastructure loan program for heat abatement.

1540.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
1540.title: Relating To Underground Storage Tanks.
1540.description: Requires the fuel tank advisory committee to meet at least twice within a same calendar year at least six months apart. Effective upon approval. (SD1)

1548.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Eli, Har excused (2).
1548.title: Relating To Orders Of The Campaign Spending Commission.
1548.description: Provides that the right to a contested case hearing is deemed waived if a person does not request a hearing within an unspecified number of days of receipt of the commission's preliminary determination. Permits an order of the commission to be confirmed as a judgment in the circuit court, giving the order the same force and effect as any other judgment issued by the circuit courts; provided that there shall be no appeal from the judgment. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

1549.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Holt, Takayama excused (2).
1549.title: Relating To Campaign Finance Reports.
1549.description: Provides that candidate committees may reimburse the candidate or other individuals for expenditures made on the candidate's behalf. Clarifies that preliminary primary and preliminary general reports are due ten days before the primary or general election. Amends the requirements for the statements of information for electioneering communications. Takes effect on 7/1/2050. (HD1)

1550.last_action: Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 384).
1550.title: Relating To Campaign Contributions.
1550.description: Provides that excess contributions by nonresident contributors shall be returned to a nonresident contributor of the candidate' or candidate committee's within 30 days of notice of the excess from the Campaign Spending Commission, after determination of any excess by the Commission based on the final election period report, or else escheat to the Hawaii election campaign fund. Takes effect 11/4/2020. (SD1)

1555.last_action: Referred to TRN, FIN, referral sheet 2
1555.title: Relating To Registration Of Vehicles.
1555.description: Authorizes the director of finance of each county to require that the owner of an abandoned vehicle repay the county for any towing, removal, or disposal costs incurred by that vehicle as a condition to receiving a certificate of vehicle registration or authorizing the transfer of certain vehicles.

1560.title: Relating To Housing Development.
1560.description: Provides to each county legislative body the ability to review and approve land use district boundary amendments for affordable housing projects on 15 acres or less.

1566.last_action: Referred to TRN, JUD, referral sheet 2
1566.title: Relating To The Use Of Intoxicants While Operating A Vehicle.
1566.description: Lowers the threshold of blood alcohol concentration for the offense of operating a vehicle while under the influence of an intoxicant.

1567.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Holt, Takayama excused (2).
1567.title: Relating To Cesspools.
1567.description: Extends the tax credit for the upgrade, conversion, or connection of a qualified cesspool until 12/31/2025. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

1568.last_action: The hearing on this measure has been cancelled until further notice.
1568.title: Relating To Gift Certificates.
1568.description: Clarifies that certain county-issued cards and certificates are not subject to the State's unfair and deceptive practices regulations related to gift certificates. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

1569.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with Representative(s) McKelvey, Perruso, Thielen, Wildberger voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Holt, Takayama excused (2).
1569.title: Relating To Felonies.
1569.description: Includes as a class C felony the offense of interference with the operation of an automated public transit vehicle, system, or service. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

1576.last_action: The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1576.title: Relating To Disorderly Conduct.
1576.description: Amends the offense of disorderly conduct to include engaging in conduct with intent to convey false or misleading information.

1579.last_action: The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1579.title: Relating To Offenses Against Property Rights.
1579.description: Establishes the offense of unauthorized detention of propelled vehicle, which applies if a propelled vehicle is stolen and a person obtains possession of the vehicle from another without first making a reasonable inquiry as to whether the other party had the legal right to sell or deliver the vehicle.

1582.last_action: The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1582.title: Relating To Theft In The Second Degree.
1582.description: Amends the offense of theft in the second degree to include theft of property commonly used to store items of personal or monetary value, including any purse, handbag, or wallet.

1583.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on LMG with none voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Okimoto voting no (1) and Representative(s) McDermott, Yamashita excused (2).
1583.title: Relating To The Department Of The Prosecuting Attorney.
1583.description: Appropriates funds as a grant-in-aid to the Department of the Prosecuting Attorney for the City and County of Honolulu for the Career Criminal Prosecution Unit. Takes effect on 7/1/2050. (HD1)

1584.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on LMG with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McDermott, Yamashita excused (2).
1584.title: Relating To Executive Pardons.
1584.description: Allows the governor to refer applications for pardon to the attorney general for consideration and investigation, and requires the attorney general to make a recommendation. Establishes a comprehensive application process for executive pardons. Requires the director of public safety and Hawaii paroling authority to investigate every application for pardon referred to them by the governor, if necessary. Takes effect on 7/1/2050. (HD1)

1585.last_action: The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1585.title: Relating To Sexual Assault.
1585.description: Amends the offenses of sexual assault in the first and third degree, when perpetrated against someone who is mentally defective, to remove the standard of proof regarding knowledge that the other person was mentally defective, as that term is defined in section 707-700, Hawaii Revised Statutes.

1586.last_action: The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1586.title: Relating To Abuse Of A Family Or Household Member.
1586.description: Amends the penal code to add abuse of a family or household member to felonies that qualify for repeat offender sentencing.

1587.last_action: Referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 2
1587.title: Relating To The Definition Of Property.
1587.description: Updates the definition of "property" to expressly include intellectual property for purposes of prosecuting property crimes.

1588.last_action: The hearing on this measure has been cancelled until further notice.
1588.title: Relating To Eyewitness Identification.
1588.description: Amends Act 281, Session Laws of Hawaii 2019 (Act 281), to provide clarification and flexibility in eyewitness identification procedures. Amends the effective date of Act 281 to 9/1/2020. Takes effect on 7/1/2050. (HD1)

1590.last_action: The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1590.title: Proposing Amendments To Article V Of The Constitution Of The State Of Hawaii To Authorize Legislation Regarding The Process By Which Criminal Reprieves, Commutations, And Pardons Are Submitted To And Considered By The Governor.
1590.description: Proposes amendments to the Constitution of the State of Hawaii relating to the authorization of legislation governing the process by which executive reprieves, commutations, and pardons are submitted to and considered by the governor.

1592.title: Relating To Wildlife Offenses.
1592.description: Provides that all animal parts, products, or items containing prohibited animal parts or products involved in the commission of wildlife trafficking or certain hunting offenses shall be considered contraband to be forfeited to and disposed of by the State. (HD1)

1593.last_action: The hearing on this measure has been cancelled until further notice.
1593.title: Relating To Witness Fees And Reimbursements In Criminal Cases.
1593.description: Clarifies applicable reimbursement to the State or the defense for expert witness fees, as it pertains to testimony, preparation, and in-court attendance in state court criminal proceedings. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD2)

1594.last_action: Referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 2
1594.title: Relating To Eyewitness Identifications.
1594.description: Repeals Act 281, Session Laws of Hawaii 2019, which codifies law enforcement investigation procedures for eyewitness identifications.

1603.last_action: Referred to LAB, FIN, referral sheet 2
1603.title: Relating To The Reduced Ignition Propensity Cigarette Program.
1603.description: Authorizes the state fire council to hire all reduced ignition propensity cigarette program employees as necessary; without regard to chapters 76 and 89, Hawaii Revised Statutes; and on a part-time or full-time basis.

1604.last_action: Referred to LHE, FIN, referral sheet 2
1604.title: Relating To Educational Benefits.
1604.description: Establishes the surviving firefighter family member program within the University of Hawaii to provide tuition waivers to eligible spouses and children of firefighters killed or severely injured in the line of duty. Appropriates funds.

1609.last_action: Re-referred to TRN, JUD, referral sheet 18
1609.title: Relating To Intoxicants.
1609.description: Adds a definition of "substance abuse" and amends the definitions of "drug" and "substance" for purposes of operating a vehicle under the influence of an intoxicant violations.

1619.last_action: Referred to TRN, JUD, referral sheet 2
1619.title: Relating To Traffic Safety.
1619.description: Requires vehicles on certain areas of Hana highway, behind which a certain number of vehicles are formed in a line, to use turnouts on the highway to let those other vehicles proceed when passing is unsafe.

1621.last_action: Referred to TRN, JUD, referral sheet 2
1621.title: Relating To Operating A Vehicle Under The Influence Of An Intoxicant.
1621.description: Lowers the threshold blood alcohol concentration from 0.08 to 0.05 for the offenses of Operating a Vehicle Under the Influence of an Intoxicant and Habitually Operating a Vehicle Under the Influence of an Intoxicant.

1623.last_action: Referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 2
1623.title: Relating To Community Meetings.
1623.description: Provides that the limit on the number of attendees for meetings described in section 92-2.5(e), Hawaii Revised Statutes, shall not apply to members of a county council.

1624.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McDermott, Saiki excused (2).
1624.title: Relating To A Water Storage And Distribution System For Certain Agricultural Land In Wahiawa, Oahu.
