2054.description: Appropriates funds for the Office of Planning to conduct a business climate report. Takes effect on 7/1/2112. (HD1)

2060.last_action: The committee(s) on FIN recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2060.title: Relating To Hawaiian Home Lands.
2060.description: Requires at least 5 Hawaiian Homes Commission members to be Native Hawaiian or current Hawaiian homestead lessees; and at least 2 of those 5 to be on the waitlist for Hawaiian home lands. Authorizes commission members to elect a chairperson and vice chairperson. Creates the position of Director of Hawaiian Home Lands and separates the Director's responsibilities from those of the Chairperson of the Commission. Effective July 1, 2050. (HD2)

2064.last_action: The hearing on this measure has been cancelled until further notice.
2064.title: Relating To The Elderly.
2064.description: Establishes the offense of financial exploitation of an elder and provides enhanced penalties. Amends mandatory reporting requirements for suspected financial abuse of an elder. Requires DHS to share records with the appropriate county police departments or offices of the prosecuting attorney. Effective 12/31/2059. (HD2)

2066.last_action: Referred to CPC/JUD, FIN, referral sheet 5
2066.title: Relating To Time Sharing.
2066.description: Provides purchasers of time shares with rescission rights if there is a material change to the information contained in the disclosure statement. Requires developers to provide notice to the purchaser regarding any pertinent or material change made to the disclosure statement.

2073.last_action: Referred to PVM, JUD, referral sheet 5
2073.title: Related To Concealed Carry Reform.
2073.description: Amends concealed carry statute to align with constitutional law. Add more rigorous training measures for licensed concealed carry residents.

2074.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on TRN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0).
2074.title: Relating To Disabled Veterans.
2074.description: Creates an exemption from the annual vehicle weight tax for qualified disabled veterans.

2075.last_action: Referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 5
2075.title: Relating To Abortion.
2075.description: Requires that a mother be informed of whether her fetus has a detectable heartbeat prior to consenting to an abortion. Provides for criminal penalties against a physician or surgeon who performs an abortion without obtaining informed consent relating to fetal heartbeat.

2077.last_action: Referred to HLT, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 5
2077.title: Relating To Medical Examiners.
2077.description: Requires the counties to have medical examiners who are licensed physicians and certified anatomic or forensic pathologists. Repeals section providing for coroners.

2082.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McDermott, Yamashita excused (2).
2082.title: Relating To Family Courts.
2082.description: Requires that a child consult with legal counsel or with a parent, guardian, or legal custodian prior to any custodial interrogation and prior to waiving any rights against self-incrimination. Provides that statements obtained in violation of these requirements may be admissible if the information sought was narrowly tailored and reasonably necessary to address an imminent threat. Takes effect on 12/31/2059. (HD1)

2083.last_action: Re-referred to LAB, FIN, referral sheet 8
2083.title: Relating To Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts.
2083.description: Establishes Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts for all working taxpayers. Defines qualifying individuals and eligible expenses. Outlines the requirements and limitations of the accounts. Applies to taxable years beginning after 12/31/2020.

2084.title: Relating To Individual Income Tax Reductions.
2084.description: Eliminates the individual income tax for single filers and heads of households making less than $20,000 or joint filers making less than $40,000 and increases the income tax rate more slowly for low and medium-income filers.

2089.last_action: Referred to LAB, FIN, referral sheet 5
2089.title: Relating To Public Improvements.
2089.description: Establishes a sidewalk installation grant program to be administered by the Department of Labor and Industrial Relations Office of Community Services. Appropriates funds.

2091.last_action: Referred to LHE, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 5
2091.title: Relating To The State Board Of Education.
2091.description: Changes the Board of Education from one centralized Board to a Board for each county. Gives authority to county mayors to appoint members to the Board.

2092.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on CPC with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McDermott, Yamashita excused (2).
2092.title: Relating To Products Containing Sun Protection Factor Ingredients.
2092.description: Establishes a task force within the department of health to conduct a study on sun protection factor ingredients and the feasibility of further limiting their use in sunscreens in the State. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2093.title: Relating To Medicaid Benefits.
2093.description: Appropriates funds to restore diagnostic, preventive, and restorative dental benefits to adult Medicaid enrollees, provided DHS obtains maximum federal matching funds available. Takes effect on December 31, 2059. (HD2)

2097.last_action: Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 417).
2097.title: Relating To The Traffic Code.
2097.description: Amends the statewide traffic code to allow for the chairperson of the BLNR and county chiefs of police to designate state or county employees or contractors to issue citations for traffic violations. Effective upon approval. (SD2)

2100.last_action: The committee on HRE deferred the measure.
2100.title: Relating To Technology Transfer At The University Of Hawaii.
2100.description: Extends the sunset provision in Act 38, Session Laws of Hawaii 2017, for certain exemptions from the Ethics Code as related to UH technology transfer from 6/30/2022 to 6/30/2025. Takes effect on July 1, 2050. (HD2)

2101.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
2101.title: Relating To The Conference Center Revolving Fund.
2101.description: Expands the scope of the University of Hawaii at Hilo conference center revolving fund to all programs conducted by the University of Hawaii at Hilo. Requires an annual report to the Legislature regarding the fund. Gives the chancellor of the University of Hawaii at Hilo, rather than the dean of the college of continuing education and community service, authority to expend moneys from the fund. (SD1)

2108.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on CPC with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McDermott, Yamashita excused (2).
2108.title: Relating To Broadband Development.
2108.description: Appropriates funds to the Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism for cable landing infrastructure. Takes effect on 7/1/2112. (HD1)

2116.last_action: The hearing on this measure has been cancelled until further notice.
2116.title: Relating To Sexual Offenses.
2116.description: Amends the offense of solicitation of a minor for prostitution by specifying that the act of offering or agreeing to any type of consideration, rather than payment of a fee, constitutes solicitation of a minor. Makes solicitation of a minor a class B felony. Clarifies that the offender's state of mind is not required when the person solicited is a law enforcement officer who holds themselves out as a minor. Imposes a criminal penalty on any parent, guardian, or person having custody or control of a minor that offers or agrees for consideration for the purpose of another person engaging in sexual conduct with the minor. Imposes a criminal penalty on any person that entices a parent, guardian, or person having custody or control of a minor by electronic means for the purposes of engaging in sexual conduct with the minor. Imposes a criminal penalty on any person that solicits another for prostitution of a minor. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2120.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
2120.title: Relating To The Animal Industry Special Fund.
2120.description: Allows revenue generated by the state veterinary laboratory and animal disease control branch to be deposited into the Animal Industry Special Fund. Effective on 7/1/2020. (SD1)

2121.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
2121.title: Relating To The Important Agricultural Land Qualified Agricultural Cost Tax Credit.
2121.description: Extends the time that the Department of Agriculture may certify important agricultural lands qualified agricultural costs for purposes of the important qualified agricultural costs tax credit through the 2030 tax year. Effective 7/1/2020. (SD1)

2123.last_action: Re-referred to LAB, FIN, referral sheet 11
2123.title: Relating To Hawaii Products.
2123.description: Exempts construction procurements from the Hawaii products preference in section 103D-1002, Hawaii Revised Statutes.

2124.last_action: Referred to LAB/IAC, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 5
2124.title: Relating To The Access Hawaii Committee.
2124.description: Gives agencies more flexibility and online options to provide enhanced digital services to the public in order to better serve the public and businesses.

2125.last_action: Referred to LAB/EDB, FIN, referral sheet 5
2125.title: Relating To Information Technology Steering Committee.
2125.description: Preserves the continuity of the Information Technology Steering Committee to properly administer 27-43, Hawaii Revised Statutes, while redefining the composition of the committee.

2127.last_action: Referred to LAB, FIN, referral sheet 5
2127.title: Relating To The Reissuance Of Payroll Checks.
2127.description: Amends section 40-53(a), Hawaii Revised Statutes, to all reissuance due to a non-received, lost, fraudulent, or altered payroll check to be assessed a $50 fee per check.

2129.last_action: The hearing on this measure has been cancelled until further notice.
2129.title: Relating To Making An Emergency Appropriation To The Stadium Authority.
2129.description: Makes an emergency appropriation to provide funds for the stadium authority for payroll, various repair and maintenance costs, contracts for services, and operating equipment. Effective on 1/1/2050. (HD1)

2130.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McDermott excused (1).
2130.title: Relating To Emergency Procurement.
2130.description: Amends section 103D-307, HRS, relating to emergency procurements, to add equipment failures, repairs to public property to protect against further loss of, or damage to public property, to prevent or minimize serious disruption in continued functioning of government services. Replaces chief procurement officer approval with an accounting report to the legislature within a certain time after the end of the fiscal year in which the procurement was made. Effective 1/1/2050. (HD1)

2132.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with Representative(s) Thielen voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) McKelvey voting no (1) and Representative(s) Eli, Har excused (2).
2132.title: Making Appropriations For Claims Against The State, Its Officers, Or Its Employees.
2132.description: Makes appropriations for claims against the State, its officers, and its employees. Takes effect on 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2138.last_action: Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 370).
2138.title: Relating To Notaries Public.
2138.description: Updates the laws regarding notaries public to conform to the Revised Uniform Law on Notarial Acts (2018), the Hawaii Uniform Electronic Transactions Act, other state notary laws, and current notary practices. Takes effect on 9/1/2020. (SD2)

2139.title: Relating To Law Enforcement Vehicles.
2139.description: Allows the Department of the Attorney General to have law enforcement vehicles, with colored lights, that are recognized authorized emergency vehicles.

2143.title: Relating To The Hawaii Film And Creative Industries Development Special Fund.
2143.description: Makes an appropriation out of the Hawaii Film and Creative Industries Development Special Fund. Makes a housekeeping, technical amendment to section 201-113, Hawaii Revised Statutes. Takes effect on 7/1/2112. (HD1)

2144.last_action: Referred to EEP/WLH, FIN, referral sheet 5
2144.title: Relating To The Brownfields Cleanup Revolving Loan Fund.
2144.description: Enables use of funds for environmental site assessments and for sub-grants to eligible entities for assessment and cleanup of brownfields sites.

2146.title: Making Emergency Appropriations For Public Employment Cost Items.
2146.description: Makes emergency appropriations for fiscal biennium 2019-2021 for collective bargaining cost items, including the cost of salary adjustments negotiated between the State and the bargaining representative, for collective bargaining unit (2) and their excluded counterparts. Effective upon approval. (SD1)

2154.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McDermott excused (1).
2154.title: Relating To The Hawaii Employer-union Health Benefits Trust Fund Employee-beneficiary Monthly Contributions.
2154.description: Amends section 87A-40, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to mandate that newly retired employees pay their share of health benefits premiums through monthly electronic deductions from their employees' retirement system pension or their financial institution. Effective 1/1/2050. (HD1)

2155.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Holt, Takayama excused (2).
2155.title: Relating To Compensation For The Purposes Of The Employees' Retirement System.
2155.description: Amends the definition of "base pay" and "compensation" for retirement benefits. Effective January 1, 2050. (HD1)

2156.title: Relating To Qualified Domestic Relations Orders.
2156.description: Clarifies benefits to alternate payees, advisory review determinations of Hawaii domestic relations orders, and the priority of multiple orders. Effective 1/1/2050. (HD1)

2157.last_action: The committee(s) on LAB recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2157.title: Relating To Employees' Retirement System Investments.
2157.description: Exempts certain specific types of alternative investment fund information from disclosure under chapter 92F, the disclosure of which would put the system at a competitive disadvantage and frustrate its legitimate government function.

2158.last_action: The hearing on this measure has been cancelled until further notice.
2158.title: Relating To Employees' Retirement System Disability Retirement.
2158.description: Clarifies the employees' retirement system's eligibility requirement definitions for service-connected disability and accidental death benefits. Effective 1/1/2050. (HD1)

2159.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
2159.title: Relating To Professional And Vocational Licensing Trust Funds.
2159.description: Allows the contractors license board and real estate commission to adjust, reduce, suspend, or cease collection of recovery fund and education fund fees to maintain a reasonable relation between the fees generated and the cost of services rendered by the funds. Caps the contractors recovery fund, contractors education fund, real estate recovery fund, real estate education fund, and condominium education trust fund at amounts determined biennially by the contractors license board or real estate commission. (SD1)

2160.title: Relating To The Contractors Recovery Fund.
2160.description: Increases the monetary amount an injured homeowner may recover from the Contractors Recovery Fund. Repeals 6/30/2023. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2161.last_action: Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 417).
2161.title: Relating To Securities.
2161.description: Protects elders and vulnerable adults from financial exploitation in relation to securities. (SD2)

2162.last_action: Report adopted. referred to the committee(s) on FIN as amended in HD 2 with Representative(s) Cachola, Okimoto voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McDermott excused (1).
2162.title: Relating To Hurricane Preparedness.
2162.description: Establishes the safe home program to provide matching and nonmatching grants for installation of wind resistive devices to single-family, owner-occupied, residential property owners. Creates one temporary position within the insurance division of the department of commerce and consumer affairs to implement and administer the safe home program. Repeals the loss mitigation grant program. Appropriates funds. Effective 7/1/2025. (HD2)

2163.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McDermott, Saiki excused (2).
2163.title: Relating To Mixed Martial Arts.
2163.description: Allows mixed martial arts promoters to pay contestants and their managers with cash. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2165.last_action: Report adopted. referred to the committee(s) on FIN as amended in HD 2 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Eli, Har excused (2).
2165.title: Relating To Mental Health Counselors.
2165.description: Clarifies that the practicum internship experience requirement is to be included with the course work in counseling requirement for mental health counselors. Permits applicants to fulfill all or part of their face-to-face clinical supervision requirement by a videoconference service. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD2)

2166.last_action: The committee on WAM deferred the measure.
2166.title: Relating To Massage Therapy.
2166.description: Requires the Board of Massage Therapy to adopt and enforce sanitation rules for massage establishments. Repeals existing statutory language that classifies unlicensed activity as a petty misdemeanor in favor of existing statutes that treat unlicensed activity as a misdemeanor. Increases the minimum fine from $100 to $250 and the maximum fine from $1,000 to $2,000 for each violation of the massage therapy laws. (SD1)

2167.last_action: Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 417).
2167.title: Relating To The Mortgage Loan Recovery Fund.
2167.description: Expands the pool of persons eligible to receive restitution from the Mortgage Loan Recovery Fund. (SD2)

2168.last_action: Report adopted. referred to the committee(s) on FIN as amended in HD 2 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Eli, Har excused (2).
2168.title: Relating To State Service Fees.
2168.description: Clarifies that the Department of Commerce and Consumer Affairs is authorized to increase or decrease all service fees or nontax revenue collected by the Department, subject to the approval of the Governor. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD2)

2170.last_action: Re-referred to IAC/TRN, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 9
2170.title: Relating To Port Pilots.
2170.description: Aligns the license renewal requirements with those of other professions and vocations. Removes the use of rates from comparable ports for rate increase petitions.

2171.last_action: The committee(s) on CPC recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2171.title: Relating To Cemetery Authority Exemption.
2171.description: Clarifies that churches granted an exemption under section 441-22.1, Hawaii Revised Statutes, are exempt from all requirements of chapter 441, Hawaii Revised Statutes, and that other exempted entities shall comply with any provision of this chapter upon order of the director of commerce and consumer affairs. Takes effect 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2172.last_action: Re-referred to CPC, FIN, referral sheet 9
2172.title: Relating To The Public Utilities Commission Special Fund Carryover Balance.
2172.description: Increases the balance that may be retained in the Public Utilities Commission Special Fund at the end of each fiscal year from $1,000,000 to $3,000,000.

2173.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McDermott, Quinlan excused (2).
2173.title: Relating To The Hawaii Emergency Management Agency.
2173.description: Establishes the hazard mitigation special fund for the Hawaii emergency management agency. Appropriates funds. (HD1)

2174.last_action: Referred to PVM/LAB, FIN, referral sheet 5
2174.title: Relating To Hawaii Emergency Management Agency.
2174.description: Converts the public information officer, civil defense administrative officer, branch chiefs, and emergency operations center state warning point personnel in the Hawaii Emergency Management Agency from civil service status to exempt status.

2175.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Gates excused (1).
2175.title: Relating To Emergency Management.
2175.description: Establishes a long-term recovery authority to work with the state disaster recovery coordinator in enhancing the capacity of the government, relevant agencies, and the community to recover from the impacts of disasters and build resilience and sustainability in the State. Appropriates funds. (HD1)

2176.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Holt, Takayama excused (2).
2176.title: Relating To Statewide Interoperable Public Safety Communications.
2176.description: Establishes a statewide interoperable communications executive committee for public safety communications, statewide interoperable communications technical subcommittee to provide technical advice to the executive committee, and the position of the statewide interoperable communications coordinator. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2179.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McDermott, Quinlan excused (2).
2179.title: Relating To Office Of Youth Services.
2179.description: Establishes the Office of Youth Services Revolving Fund. Permits individual vocational programs within the purview of the Office of Youth Services to engage in commercial enterprises, including the sale of goods and services, for self-sustainability purposes, for young adults only. Effective 12/31/2059. (HD1)

2180.last_action: The hearing on this measure has been cancelled until further notice.
2180.title: Relating To Reports Of Child Abuse.
2180.description: Adds immunity from civil and criminal liability for individuals who provide information or assistance in child abuse investigations. Effective 12/31/2059. (HD1)

2181.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McDermott, Quinlan excused (2).
2181.title: Relating To Chronically Homeless.
2181.description: Amends the definition of "chronically homeless individual" to provide clarity and improve the delivery and development of homeless services. Effective 12/31/2059. (HD1)

2183.last_action: The hearing on this measure has been cancelled until further notice.
2183.title: Relating To Residency Requirements In State Hiring.
2183.description: Exempts dependents of military servicemembers from state residency requirement for employment with state or county government. Effective 1/1/2050. (HD2)

2184.title: Relating To Dead Bodies.
2184.description: Clarifies prohibited actions related to anatomical gifts and disposition of bodies. Effective 1/1/2021. (SD1)

2185.last_action: Referred to HLT, FIN, referral sheet 5
2185.title: Relating To Marriage License Fees.
2185.description: Amends the marriage license statute to support the Hawaii Birth Defects Program, modernization of the vital statistics system, and operating costs of marriage license agents.

2187.last_action: Re-referred to HLT, FIN, referral sheet 23
2187.title: Relating To The Medicare Civil Monetary Penalty Special Fund.
2187.description: Repeals the ceiling for using moneys in the civil monetary penalty special fund for use by the Department of Health for CMS-approved compliance activities.

2189.last_action: Referred to HLT, FIN, referral sheet 5
2189.title: Relating To Hearing And Vision Program.
2189.description: Amends the hearing and vision program statute to increase the early identification of children with hearing or vision loss, by establishing consistent protocols for hearing and vision screening and follow-up, screener training, and data collection for quality improvement.

2193.last_action: Referred to HLT, FIN, referral sheet 5
2193.title: Relating To Mental Health And Substance Abuse Special Fund.
2193.description: Authorizes expenditures from the mental health and substance abuse special fund to be used for capital improvement projects.

2195.last_action: Referred to LAB, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 5
2195.title: Relating To The Boiler And Elevator Safety Law.
2195.description: Authorizes the Director of Labor and Industrial Relations to allow third-party inspectors and third-party inspection companies to conduct certain types of elevator inspections; effective July 1, 2020, repealed June 30, 2025.

2197.last_action: Referred to WLH, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 5
2197.title: Relating To State Boating Facilities.
2197.description: Authorizes the Board of Land and Natural Resources to lease any existing state boating facility in part or in its entirety, and fast lands and submerged lands within any existing state boating facility, by public auction, request for proposals, or direct negotiation for private development, management, and operation. Clarifies that legislative approval is not required to award a lease. Repeals fast lands and submerged lands lease authorization for Ala Wai Boat Harbor under section 200-2.6, Hawaii Revised Statutes.

2198.last_action: Referred to WLH, FIN, referral sheet 5
2198.title: Relating To State Small Boat Harbor Fees.
2198.description: Amends the various fees the Department of Land and Natural Resources may charge for the usage of state small boat harbors. Amends the manner in which those fees are applied.

2199.last_action: The committee(s) on TRN recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2199.title: Relating To Boating Reports.
2199.description: Requires the fire chief and the ocean safety director of each county, in addition to the Director of Public Safety and the police chief of each county, to transmit to the Department of Land and Natural Resources a copy of every report relating to boating accidents or the theft, loss, or recovery of vessels. Requires all reports submitted pursuant to section 200-27, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to be unredacted.

2200.last_action: Re-referred to WLH, FIN, referral sheet 9
2200.title: Relating To Ocean Recreation Commercial Permits.
2200.description: Authorizes the Department of Land and Natural Resources to issue new ocean recreation commercial permits by public auction.

2201.last_action: The committee(s) on WLH recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2201.title: Relating To Disposition Of Water Licenses By The Board Of Land And Natural Resources.
2201.description: Clarifies the conditions and manner in which the Board of Land and Natural Resources may dispose water by license.

2202.last_action: The hearing on this measure has been cancelled until further notice.
2202.title: Relating To Authorizing The Department Of Land And Natural Resources To Lease Pasture Lands On Terms That Promote Collaborative Beneficial Use For Forestry, Wildlife, Recreational, And Food Production Purposes.
2202.description: Authorizes the Board of Land and Natural Resources to amend and extend existing pasture leases and to issue new pasture leases by negotiation in furtherance of public purposes. Requires DLNR and DOA to identify potentially transferable lands whose land use classification is at dispute and petition the land use commission for a determination. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2203.last_action: Referred to TIA/WLH, FIN, referral sheet 5
2203.title: Relating To Lifeguard Services At State Park Beaches.
2203.description: Allocates Transient Accommodations Tax revenues to the Department of Land and Natural Resources to cover lifeguard service expenses incurred at state park beaches.

2205.last_action: Referred to HLT, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 5
2205.title: Relating To The Electronic Prescription Accountability System.
2205.description: Updates section 329-104(c), Hawaii Revised Statutes, to clarify who may access information stored in the electronic prescription accountability system.

2209.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Eli, Har excused (2).
2209.title: Relating To Withholding Tax.
2209.description: Amends the due date for employers to file the wage and tax statement from the last day of February to January 31 following the close of the calendar year. Imposes a penalty on employers that fail to timely furnish and file the wage and tax statement. Effective 1/1/2050. (HD1)

2211.title: Relating To Tax Administration.
2211.description: Allows the Department of Taxation to mandate the electronic filing of partnership and S-corporation returns if the taxpayer's gross receipts exceed $250,000. Requires certain tax return preparers to file returns electronically. Amends the rules for electronic funds transfer to remove the authorization to require electronic funds transfer or electronic filing if the federal government required that person to file or pay electronically. Removes the timeliness requirement from the electronic funds transfer penalty. Removes the authority of the department to charge for certified copies of tax clearances. Amends the statute that mandates tax clearances for liquor license holders. Clarifies the interest rate for payments made to taxpayers out of the litigated claims fund.

2212.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McDermott, Saiki excused (2).
2212.title: Relating To Rental Motor Vehicle Marketplace Facilitators.
2212.description: Deems rental motor vehicle marketplace facilitators to be the lessors and operators for purposes of the rental motor vehicle and tour vehicle surcharge tax. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2213.last_action: Re-referred to TRN, FIN, referral sheet 9
2213.title: Relating To Payment For Airport Charges.
2213.description: Amends the law relating to use of credit cards to pay for airport charges to add the use of debit cards and online electronic payments; allows the airports to pay for processing fees and charges; imposes additional processing fees or charges upon the user for online electronic payments such as Automated Clearing House (ACH) payments and for credit and debit cards; and allows the airports to have the user pay for processing fees and charges directly to the credit or debit card processor.

2215.last_action: Referred to TRN/WLH, FIN, referral sheet 5
2215.title: Relating To Airport Zoning Act.
2215.description: Clarifies Airport Zoning Act definitions and regulations.

2218.last_action: Referred to LHE, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 5
2218.title: Relating To University Of Hawaii Research.
2218.description: Removes the sunset provision in Act 39, Session Laws of Hawaii 2017.

2222.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Holt, Takayama excused (2).
2222.title: Relating To Vacant And Abandoned Residential Structures.
2222.description: Requires counties to expedite demolition permits for vacant and abandoned residential homes. Allows the department of taxation to seek sale of the property through nonjudicial foreclosure of vacant and abandoned residential properties with outstanding recorded state tax liens at any time after establishing vacancy and abandonment. Takes effect on 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2223.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Holt, Takayama excused (2).
2223.title: Relating To Divorce.
2223.description: Grants exclusive original jurisdiction in matters of annulment, divorce, and separation and other certain cases to the family court of the circuit in which an applicant is domiciled at the time the application is filed. Repeals the requirement that a person be domiciled or physically present in the State for a continuous period of at least three months before filing for divorce. Repeals the requirement that a person be domiciled or physically present in the State for a continuous period of at least six months before completing a divorce. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2224.last_action: The hearing on this measure has been cancelled until further notice.
2224.title: Relating To Immigration.
2224.description: Makes an appropriation to the judiciary to contract with nonprofit organizations to provide legal assistance and legal counsel to immigrants in determining legal status and citizenship, provide diversion to existing services, and otherwise provide counsel for existing rights. Takes effect on 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2230.last_action: The committee(s) on WLH recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2230.title: Relating To Property Access.
2230.description: Extends the application of gathering rights to lands owned in fee simple and to landlords and landowners. Authorizes an action for easement by necessity for landlocked parcels not previously under a unity of title with the prospective subservient estate.

2234.last_action: Referred to EEP/WLH, FIN, referral sheet 5
2234.title: Relating To The Establishment Of An Ecosystem Restoration Commission.
2234.description: Establishes an ecosystem restoration commission to identify lands for environmental remediation and return ownership and control of those lands to the State, a county, or other entity.

2235.last_action: Referred to EEP/WLH, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 5
2235.title: Relating To Reducing Plastic Packaging Waste.
2235.description: Requires all retail food establishments using any food service ware for any food prepared or packaged on premises to use biodegradable, compostable, recyclable, or reusable food service ware.

2236.last_action: Referred to EEP/EDB, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 5
2236.title: Relating To Environmental Impact Statements.
2236.description: Adds definitions of "biomass" and "fossil fuels", and amends the definition of "power generating facility".

2238.last_action: Referred to EEP/WLH, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 5
2238.title: Relating To Composting.
2238.description: Establishes a class of artisan-scale composting operations exempt from department of health regulations to divert organic materials from Hawaii's landfills.

2240.last_action: Referred to EEP/TRN, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 5
2240.title: Relating To Climate Control.
2240.description: Prohibits new fossil fuel vehicles to be used for transportation effective 2025.

2243.last_action: The hearing on this measure has been cancelled until further notice.
2243.title: Relating To The Management Of State Funds.
2243.description: Amends provisions relating to the short-term investment of state moneys, including the types of financial instruments in which state moneys may be invested. Requires annual report to the legislature. Effective 1/1/2050. (HD1)

2248.last_action: Report adopted. referred to the committee(s) on FIN as amended in HD 2 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Holt, Takayama excused (2).
2248.title: Relating To Grants For Local Recycling Facilities.
2248.description: Requires the office of solid waste management to establish the recycled products manufacturing grant program to incentivize new recycled products manufacturing, bioconversion, or composting business within the State. Appropriates funds. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD2)

2249.last_action: Referred to LAB, FIN, referral sheet 5
2249.title: Relating To Socially Responsible Investing.
2249.description: Incorporates socially responsible investing in the investment decision-making of endowment, trust, or investment funds established by statute or maintained by state agencies or offices.

2250.last_action: Referred to EEP/WLH, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 5
2250.title: Relating To Energy Projects Near Residential Areas.
2250.description: Prohibits utility-scale energy projects from being constructed or located within half a mile from the boundary of any residential area.

2251.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to JDC/WAM.
2251.title: Relating To Statewide Composting.
2251.description: Requires DOH to adopt rules to establish a classification system for composting facilities or operations for the purposes of regulating them for health purposes. Allows composting and co-composting in the agricultural district, including on lands with class A or B soils. Appropriates moneys to the Department of Health for a Program Specialist position in the Solid and Hazardous Waste Branch. Effective 7/1/2020. (SD1)

2256.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
2256.title: Relating To Trauma-informed Education.
2256.description: Requires DOE to establish a threeyear pilot program for the development and implementation of a traumainformed education program in the Castle, Kailua, and Kalaheo complex areas, based on the NanakuliWaianae complex area traumainformed education programs and report to the legislature. Appropriates funds. Takes effect on 7/1/2055. (SD1)

2258.last_action: The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2258.title: Relating To Shark Protection.
2258.description: Prohibits and establishes fines and penalties for knowingly capturing, taking, possessing, abusing, harassing, entangling, or killing any shark within state marine waters. Provides certain exemptions. Exempts nationally qualified educational institutions from the requirement to obtain a special activity permit to conduct scientific and educational research activities on sharks. (HD1)

2259.last_action: Referred to WLH/HSH, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 5
2259.title: Relating To Personal Property Stored On Public Land.
2259.description: Prohibits the storing of personal property on public land without a permit or other approval from the State or a county.

2260.last_action: The committee(s) on LHE recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2260.title: Relating To Kaneohe Bay.
2260.description: Appropriates funds to create a full-time internship coordinator and cultural resource specialist positions with the Hawaii institute of marine biology at the Heeia estuarine research reserve.

2262.last_action: Referred to LMG, FIN, referral sheet 5
2262.title: Relating To Legislative Testimony.
2262.description: Requires the house and senate to permit remote testimony, via telephone, at public hearings.

2263.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Eli, Har excused (2).
2263.title: Relating To The Employment Of Persons With Disabilities.
2263.description: Establishes Employment First as a policy of the State and counties for persons with disabilities. Requires state and county agencies to implement Employment First in hiring and in all programs and services administered or funded by the State or counties. Applies Employment First principles to Medicaid home- and community-based waiver programs. Takes effect on 12/31/2059. (HD1)

2264.last_action: Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 417).
2264.title: Relating To The Hawaii Civil Rights Commission.
2264.description: Clarifies the meaning of "program or activity receiving state financial assistance". Excludes cases within the scope of the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act from the jurisdiction of the Hawaii civil rights commission. (SD2)

2265.title: Relating To The Hawai'i School For The Deaf And Blind.
2265.description: Creates a board of trustees for the Hawaii school for the deaf and blind to establish an independent governance structure for the school. Takes effect 7/1/2050. (HD2)

2266.last_action: The hearing on this measure has been cancelled until further notice.
2266.title: Relating To The Division Of Boating And Ocean Recreation.
2266.description: Requires the auditor to conduct a performance and management audit of DLNR's division of boating and ocean recreation. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2270.title: Relating To Athletics.
2270.description: Requires that DOE and athletic leagues and associations allow charter school students wishing to participate in a sport for which there is no program at the charter school in the service area where the student resides, to participate in a comparable DOE school sports program in the service area where the student resides or in an adjacent service area at no additional cost to the student. Specifies that charter school students be represented by the DOE school for athletic league or association business. Takes effect on 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2274.title: Relating To Feminine Hygiene Products.
2274.description: Requires the DOE to make feminine hygiene products available to students for free on public secondary school campuses. Takes effect on 7/1/2050. (HD2)

2275.last_action: Referred to HSH, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 5
2275.title: Relating To Assisted Living Facilities.
2275.description: Requires each assisted living facility to have at least 1 registered nurse available on its premises at all times to meet the care management and monitoring needs of its residents.

2277.last_action: Referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 5
2277.title: Relating To Evidence.
2277.description: Limits compelled disclosure of sources or unpublished information for journalists, newscasters and persons participating in collection or dissemination of news or information of substantial public interest. Establishes exceptions.

2278.last_action: Referred to TRN, JUD, referral sheet 5
2278.title: Relating To Traffic Rules.
2278.description: Requires heavy trucks having a gross vehicle weight rating of more than 10,000 pounds to drive within the right-hand lane of an interstate highway except when the heavy truck is turning left or avoiding an obstruction.

2279.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on CPC with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Holt, Takayama excused (2).
2279.title: Relating To Licensure.
2279.description: Permits an applicant for a barber shop license to identify either a licensed barber or a licensed beauty operator to qualify the barber shop for licensure. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2282.last_action: Referred to TIA, FIN, referral sheet 5
2282.title: Relating To The Hawaii Theatre Center.
2282.description: Establishes the Hawaii Theatre Center as the Hawaii State Theatre. Appropriates funds.

2286.last_action: Referred to WLH/EEP, FIN, referral sheet 5
2286.title: Relating To Waste Management.
2286.description: Prohibits any waste or disposal facility from being located in a conservation district except in emergency circumstances to mitigate significant risks to public safety and health. Requires no less than a one-half mile buffer zone for the construction, operation, modification, or expansion of a municipal solid waste landfill unit.

2296.last_action: Referred to HLT/HSH, FIN, referral sheet 5
2296.title: Relating To The State Health Insurance Assistance Program.
2296.description: Appropriates funds for the state health insurance assistance program.

2298.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to JDC.
2298.title: Relating To Critical Electrical Infrastructure.
2298.description: Establishes the offense of criminal trespass on critical electrical infrastructure. Takes effect on 7/1/2050. (SD1)

2299.title: Relating To Dementia Training.
2299.description: Requires the employers of first responders to develop and provide dementia training to first responders. Effective 12/31/2059. (HD1)

2301.last_action: Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 417).
2301.title: Relating To The Youth Vaping Epidemic.
2301.description: Bans the sale of flavored tobacco products. Prohibits mislabeling of e-liquid products containing nicotine. Establishes fines and penalties for violations. Authorizes a court to impose, as a penalty on a person eighteen to twenty-one years of age who is convicted of possession of a tobacco product or electronic smoking device, the requirement to complete a tobacco education program, complete a tobacco use cessation program, or perform community service instead of paying a fine. Effective 9/1/2020. (SD2)

2303.last_action: Report adopted. referred to the committee(s) on FIN as amended in HD 2 with Representative(s) Belatti voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Ward voting no (1) and Representative(s) Holt, Takayama excused (2).
2303.title: Relating To Medical Autonomy.
2303.description: Requires the department of health to conduct a study relating to the development and disbursement of vaccinations for modern disease outbreaks and procedures associated with medically authorized exemptions from mandatory vaccinations. Allows the department of health to partner with federal partners or universities to conduct relevant research for this study. Requires a report to the legislature. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD2)

2304.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Twenty-third Representative District.
2304.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the 23rd Representative District.

2305.last_action: The committee(s) on TRN recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2305.title: Relating To Traffic Congestion.
2305.description: Requires the Department of Transportation in collaboration with other public agencies, to research and develop methods to reduce traffic congestion and motor vehicle fuel emissions in the State.

2310.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
2310.title: Relating To Capital District Buildings.
2310.description: Establishes a pilot project for the State to provide lease space for the establishment of child care facilities at any capital district building, except Honolulu Hale, with enrollment priority for children of state employees who work in the building at which the child care facility is located. Appropriates funds. Repeals 6/30/2030. Effective 12/31/2059. (SD1)

2315.last_action: Re-referred to WLH, CPC, JUD, referral sheet 9
2315.title: Relating To Restrictions On Agricultural Uses And Activities.
2315.description: Disallows the enforcement of a rerecorded homeowners' association restriction if the restriction prohibits bonafide agricultural uses and activities on agricultural land.

2316.last_action: The hearing on this measure has been cancelled until further notice.
2316.title: Relating To Self-help Housing.
2316.description: Establishes the self-help homeownership housing revolving fund to provide for loans and project-related technical assistance grants to nonprofit housing development organizations to support the development of affordable homeownership housing projects under a self-help housing program. Appropriates funds. Effective 7/1/2025. (HD2)

2317.last_action: Referred to TIA/WLH, FIN, referral sheet 5
2317.title: Relating To Counties.
2317.description: Makes explicit the counties' authority to enact ordinances to amortize or phase out permitted, nonconforming, or otherwise allowed short-term rentals in any zoning classification. Includes swapping, bartering, or exchange of a residential dwelling, or portion thereof, in definition of "short-term rental" for this purpose.

2318.last_action: The hearing on this measure has been cancelled until further notice.
2318.title: Relating To Emergency Workers.
2318.description: Amends the definition of "emergency worker" in the Penal Code to include communications dispatchers. Takes effect on 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2319.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
2319.title: Relating To Cargo Carriers.
2319.description: Authorizes the Public Utilities Commission to address any situation where the condition of a regulated water carrier of cargo may result in the disruption, reduction, or cessation of essential services. Amends the bases upon which the Public Utilities Commission may issue a certificate of public convenience and necessity to an applicant seeking authority to serve as a regulated water carrier. Authorizes the Department of Transportation to enter into contracts to provide subsidies to a regulated water carrier provided the carrier meets certain conditions. (SD1)

2320.title: Relating To Balloons.
2320.description: Prohibits the release, outdoors, of balloons made of electrically conductive material and filled with a gas lighter than air, as part of any public or civic event, promotional activity, or product advertisement.

2324.last_action: Re-referred to CPC, JUD, referral sheet 9
2324.title: Relating To Safe Water.
2324.description: Prohibits the introduction of fluoride to a public water system. Provides that any conflicting laws or rules are preempted.

2326.last_action: Referred to LAB/HSH, FIN, referral sheet 5
2326.title: Relating To Qualified Community Rehabilitation Programs.
2326.description: Allows community rehabilitation programs for persons with disabilities to be considered qualified under the State's procurement code without requiring federal and state certification that authorizes the payment of subminimum wage to workers in their program.

2329.last_action: The hearing on this measure has been cancelled until further notice.
2329.title: Relating To Hawaii National Guard Retirement Benefits.
2329.description: Requires the board of trustees of the employees' retirement system to conduct a study to determine and provide retirement benefits for Hawaii national guard members who are activated under state active duty orders, and submit findings and recommendations to the legislature prior to the regular session of 2022. Appropriates funds. Takes effect on 1/1/2050. (HD1)

2331.last_action: The committee(s) on EEP/WLH recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2331.title: Relating To A Hawaii Green New Deal.
2331.description: Requires the sustainability coordinator of the office of planning to complete a study on implementing a green new deal for the State. Requires the study to identify federal and international polices; review Hawaii's environmental, economic, and cultural response to the green new deal; and determine cost-effective opportunities for Hawaii to implement the green new deal.

2333.last_action: Referred to HSH, JUD, referral sheet 5
2333.title: Relating To Assault.
2333.description: Adds intentionally or knowingly causing bodily injury to a person sixty years of age or older to the statutory definition of assault in the second degree.

2334.title: Relating To Income.
2334.description: Short form bill relating to income.

2335.title: Relating To Income Equity.
2335.description: Short form bill relating to income equity.

2336.last_action: The hearing on this measure has been cancelled until further notice.
2336.title: Relating To Hydrofluorocarbons.
2336.description: Establishes regulations on the use of hydrofluorocarbons in state law. Phases out hydrofluorocarbons in favor of alternatives with lower global warming potential. Establishes a preference for products that do not contain hydrofluorocarbons in the state procurement code. Directs the Hawaii State Energy Office and the Environmental Management Division of the Department of Health to study how to increase the use of refrigerants with low global warming potential, reduce the use of hydrofluorocarbons, and recommend how to fund, structure, and prioritize a state program that incentivizes or provides grants to support the elimination of legacy uses of hydrofluorocarbons. Appropriates funds for the study to be performed by the Hawaii State Energy Office. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD2)

2337.last_action: The committee(s) on TRN/EEP recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2337.title: Relating To Carbon Emissions Reduction.
2337.description: Establishes a clean vehicle special fund to incentivize the purchase of vehicles that produce less carbon emissions by providing a rebate. Creates a graduated gasoline-powered vehicle tax to be paid by purchasers of a passenger car or pickup truck that is powered solely by gasoline and obtains only a certain number of miles per gallon.

2341.last_action: Referred to LAB, FIN, referral sheet 5
2341.title: Relating To A Living Wage.
2341.description: Requires employers doing business with state agencies pursuant to a contract, subcontract, lease, sublease, permit, or license, to pay to each of its employees a wage of not less than $15 per hour worked, adjusted annually for any increase in the cost of living. Requires concessionaires to retain employees of prior concessionaires.

2342.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
2342.title: Relating To Energy Resources.
2342.description: Amends the amount of budget appropriations for energy expenditures that agencies performing energy efficiency or renewable energy system retrofitting are entitled to receive. Repeals the required setting aside of a portion of moneys saved through the retrofitting. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

2350.title: Relating To Vital Statistics.
2350.description: Requires the department of health to issue a certificate of stillbirth, upon request of the parent or parents named on a fetal death certificate issued in the case of a stillbirth. Appropriates funds. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2359.last_action: Referred to TIA, FIN, referral sheet 5
2359.title: Relating To The 1924 Hanapepe Massacre.
2359.description: Requires the State Foundation on Culture and the Arts to erect monuments and displays on Kauai, and support other specified awareness efforts, to memorialize the 1924 Hanapepe Massacre victims and the contributions of Kauai sugar plantation laborers as a whole. Appropriates funds.

2361.last_action: Referred to TIA, FIN, referral sheet 5
2361.title: Relating To Honolua Bay.
2361.description: Appropriates funds to the Department of Land and Natural Resources for the maintenance of Honolua Bay on the island of Maui.

2362.last_action: The committee(s) on WLH recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2362.title: Relating To The County Of Maui.
2362.description: Authorizes the Director of Finance to issue general obligation bonds to the County of Maui for the upgrade of that county's R-1 water delivery systems and the Department of Land and Natural Resources for the upgrade of certain water reservoirs located in the forest watershed areas on Maui.

2363.last_action: Referred to WLH, FIN, referral sheet 5
2363.title: Relating To Safety.
2363.description: Appropriates funds to provide access to state land for lifeguards at Puu Kekaa on the island of Maui, an area under the jurisdiction of Department of Land and Natural Resources.

2364.last_action: Re-referred to LAB, FIN, referral sheet 9
2364.title: Relating To The Stadium Development District.
2364.description: Repeals and reestablishes the stadium development district under the jurisdiction of the stadium authority. Establishes the stadium development special fund. Expands the powers and duties of the stadium authority. Appropriates funds.

2365.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For Kaiser Complex Schools In The Seventeenth And Eighteenth Representative Districts.
2365.description: Appropriates funds for a capital improvement project to provide the remaining Kaiser Complex schools air conditioning for the 17th and 18th Representative Districts.

2368.last_action: The committee(s) on PVM/HSH recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2368.title: Relating To The Department Of Public Safety.
2368.description: Requires PSD to establish a mental health first aid training program that provides mandatory eight-hour sessions triennially for law enforcement, correctional officers, and other public safety officials under PSD.

2370.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
2370.title: Relating To The Department Of Human Services.
2370.description: Appropriates funds for the operating budget of the department of human services for fiscal year 2020-2021. Takes effect on December 31, 2059. (SD1)

2375.last_action: Referred to WLH/TIA, FIN, referral sheet 5
2375.title: Relating To The State Of Hawaii Museum Of Monarchy History.
2375.description: Appropriates funds for the purposes of restoration, repair, maintenance, operation, and 1 permanent full-time equivalent (1.0 FTE) groundskeeper for Iolani Palace.

2377.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
2377.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The State Archives.
2377.description: Authorizes the issuance of general obligation bonds to finance plans for a state archives master plan. Appropriates funds. Takes effect on 1/1/2050. (SD1)

2378.title: Making An Appropriation To The Office Of The Prosecuting Attorney For The County Of Hawaii.
2378.description: Appropriates funds for the career criminal prosecution unit of the office of the prosecuting attorney of the county of Hawaii. Takes effect on July 1, 2050. (HD1)

2380.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Twenty-first Representative District.
2380.description: Authorizes issuance of general obligation bonds and appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the 21st Representative District.

2381.last_action: The hearing on this measure has been cancelled until further notice.
2381.title: Relating To The Funding Of Grants Pursuant To Chapter 42f, Hawaii Revised Statutes.
2381.description: Appropriates operating and capital improvement grants for fiscal year 2020. Effective 7/1/2020.

2385.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to WAM.
2385.title: Relating To Helping Working Families.
2385.description: Makes the state earned income tax credit refundable and permanent. Increases and amends the refundable food/excise tax credit by basing the amount of the credit on a taxpayer's Hawaii earned income and federal adjusted gross income. Increases minimum wage rate to $11.00 per hour beginning on 1/1/2021, $12.00 per hour beginning on 1/1/2022, $12.50 per hour beginning on 1/1/2023, and $13.00 per hour beginning on 1/1/2024. (HD1)

2386.title: Relating To Land Development.
2386.description: Authorizes the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation to lease real property for a period not to exceed 99 years for the development of certain projects that include affordable housing. Requires the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation to submit a report to the legislature that identifies all state lands that may be developed for multi-unit dwellings. Authorizes the issuance of $200,000,000 in general obligation bonds, with the proceeds used for the establishment of infrastructure to support the development of housing on lands near the University of Hawaii West Oahu campus. Authorizes the issuance of $75,000,000 in general obligation bonds, with the proceeds used for affordable housing infrastructure in counties with a resident population of 500,000 or less. Authorizes a state or county department or agency to petition the appropriate county land use decision-making authority, rather than the Land Use Commission, for a change in the boundary of a district involving land areas between 15 acres and 25 acres where the majority of the development will be for affordable housing. Authorizes the State Historic Preservation Division to delegate the responsibility of historic preservation project reviews to the impacted county. Establishes the Office of the Housing Ombudsman. Removes the existing statutory cap on the amount of conveyance tax revenues that are deposited into the rental housing revolving fund each fiscal year.

2387.title: Relating To Access To Learning.
2387.description: Requires parents or guardians of public school and charter school kindergarten students to disclose information on the student's prior child care program or prekindergarten attendance, if any, for the purpose of determining areas having the highest need for prekindergarten and child care programs. Requires assessment of public school and charter school kindergarten students. Removes public charter school prekindergarten programs from the administrative authority of the Executive Office on Early Learning. Establishes that the State Public Charter School Commission has administrative authority over all state-funded early learning programs in public charter schools. Establishes the preschool open doors special fund. Expands Preschool Open Doors Program eligibility from 4-year-old children to all children who are 3 to 4 years old who are in the 2 years prior to kindergarten entry. Requires annual reporting regarding the revenues and expenditures of the early learning special fund. Establishes a program for Department of Human Services to award grants for preschools. Authorizes positions for the Preschool Open Doors Program. Appropriates funds for Department of Human Services to expand its information technology system for the purpose of managing information on prekindergarten attendance and child care need and to contract for and operate preschool and child care programs. Establishes the goal of providing all children who are 3 to 4 years old who are in the 2 years prior to kindergarten entry with enrollment in a preschool program by the year 2030. Appropriates funds to the University of Hawaii for building classrooms for Hawaiian language immersion pre-kindergarten programs. Appropriates funds for building early learning services classrooms on public library property. (SD2)

2388.title: Relating To A School Facilities Agency.
2388.description: Establishes the School Facilities Agency to be responsible for all public school development, planning, and construction, related to capital improvement projects assigned by the Legislature, Governor, or Board of Education. Transfers statutes pertaining to the Hawaii 3R's and 3T's programs to a new School Facilities Agency statutory subpart. Places management of school impact fees with the agency. Appropriates funds.

2389.last_action: Referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 5
2389.title: Relating To Contested Cases.
2389.description: Precludes aggrieved persons from filing additional appeals with the supreme court arising in contested case hearings of the commission on water resource management, land use commission, public utilities commission, Hawaii community development authority, and those involving conservation districts regarding contested issues that those aggrieved persons knew or may have known but did not raise before the agency issued a final decision.

2392.last_action: The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2392.title: Relating To Courts Of Appeal.
2392.description: Prohibits courts of appeal from affirming, modifying, reversing, or vacating a matter on grounds other than those raised by the parties to the proceeding, unless the parties are provided the opportunity to brief the court and present oral argument on the matter.

2393.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
2393.title: Relating To Constitutional Amendments.
2393.description: Requires the language and meaning of any proposed constitutional amendment and ratification question to be as simple, concise, and direct as possible considering the complexity of the subject matter. Allows the presiding officers of the Legislature to request a written opinion of the Supreme Court regarding the legality of a proposed amendment to the Hawaii State Constitution and the corresponding constitutional ratification question. Requires the court to provide a written opinion within 14 days of receipt of the request. Prohibits any appeal of a written opinion. (SD1)

2398.last_action: Referred to LHE/EDB, FIN, referral sheet 5
2398.title: Relating To Teacher Education.
2398.description: Establishes a network improvement community task force to develop a K-12 science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) teacher education degree for the University of Hawaii. Appropriates funds.

2399.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McDermott, Saiki excused (2).
2399.title: Relating To The Na Wai Eha Watershed.
2399.description: Appropriates money out of the land conservation fund for the acquisition of 11,020 acres of the Na Wai Eha watershed in Wailuku, Maui. Takes effect on 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2405.last_action: Report adopted. referred to the committee(s) on FIN as amended in HD 2 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Holt, Takayama excused (2).
2405.title: Relating To Prescription Drug Rate Setting.
2405.description: Establishes the prescription affordability commission within the department of commerce and consumer affairs to review prescription drug costs and establish levels of reimbursement. Appropriates funds. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD2)

2406.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to JDC.
2406.title: Relating To Common Interest Communities.
2406.description: Specifies the manner in which a member of a board of a planned community association or condominium association may resign. Limits a planned community association board's ability to fill a vacancy. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

2411.last_action: The committee(s) on HLT recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2411.title: Relating To Psilocybin.
2411.description: Establishes temporary Medicinal Psilocybin Working Group. Requires reports to the Legislature.

2414.last_action: Referred to LAB/LHE, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 5
2414.title: Relating To Herbicides.
2414.description: Requires the DOE to maintain a list of herbicides approved for procurement. Prohibits the procurement of herbicides containing glyphosate. Prohibits the use of herbicides on school campuses without the approval of the head of the Auxiliary Services Branch. Effective July 1, 2022.

2415.last_action: The hearing on this measure has been cancelled until further notice.
2415.title: Relating To Theft.
2415.description: Amends the offense of theft in the second degree to include theft of property commonly used to store items of personal or monetary value, including any purse, handbag, or wallet. Requires property owners to hold illegally parked bicycles found on their property for seven days. Provides that for the first offense of theft of a bicycle, a person shall be guilty of a misdemeanor, and, for the second and each subsequent offense, shall be guilty of a class C felony. Takes effect on 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2416.last_action: The committee on JDC deferred the measure.
2416.title: Relating To Privacy.
2416.description: Modernizes "personal information" for the purposes of security breach of personal information law. Prohibits the sale of contact tracing information without consent. Amends provisions relating to electronic eavesdropping law. Prohibits certain manipulated images of individuals. Effective 9/1/2020. Sunsets 9/1/2025. (SD1)

2418.last_action: Referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 5
2418.title: Relating To Crime Prevention.
2418.description: Imposes a 1% crime prevention reward fee on all persons required to pay a fine for a penal offense. Establishes the crime prevention reward special fund to compensate individuals for the truthful reporting of penal offenses. Establishes the crime prevention reward task force to make recommendations on the administration of the crime prevention reward fee. Requires a report to the Legislature.

2420.last_action: Referred to AGR/WLH, FIN, referral sheet 5
2420.title: Relating To Agricultural Leases.
2420.description: Gives preference rights for an agricultural park lot and a non-agricultural park land lease to lessees who have made a significant improvement. Adds the same preferences for a non-agricultural park land lease as those for an agricultural park lot lease.

2426.last_action: Referred to LAB, LMG, FIN, referral sheet 5
2426.title: Relating To Temporary Staff Of The Legislature.
2426.description: Requires the legislature to provide overtime compensation to temporary staff for hours worked in excess of forty hours in a workweek. Outlines the available remedies for a violation.

2428.last_action: Referred to EDB/IAC, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 5
2428.title: Relating To A State Poker Commission.
2428.description: Establishes a State Poker Commission to oversee the licensing and operation of live poker rooms in the State. Designates as commissioners the respective directors of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism; Commerce and Consumer Affairs; and Taxation; or their designees. Appropriates funds.

2430.last_action: Referred to WLH/HSG, FIN, referral sheet 5
2430.title: Relating To Hawaii Community Development Authority.
2430.description: Authorizes the Office of Hawaiian Affairs to seek residential development of lands in Kakaako Community Development District owned by the Office of Hawaiian Affairs. Requires a public hearing prior to submission by the Office of Hawaiian Affairs to the Hawaii Community Development Authority of any plan or proposal for any residential development.

2434.title: Relating To Autonomous Vehicles.
2434.description: Establishes within DOT an autonomous vehicles testing pilot program. Requires report to the legislature. (SD2)

2436.last_action: Referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 5
2436.title: Relating To The Department Of The Attorney General.
2436.description: Appropriate funds for staff positions in the Department of the Attorney General's organized crime unit.

2437.last_action: Re-referred to TRN/EEP, CPC/JUD, FIN, referral sheet 21
2437.title: Relating To Ground Transportation.
2437.description: Prohibits the sale of new motor vehicles that are solely powered by fossil fuels and designed for personal use beginning January 1, 2030, by motor vehicle dealers and salespersons.

2438.last_action: The hearing on this measure has been cancelled until further notice.
2438.title: Relating To Blockchain Technology.
2438.description: Requires ETS to establish a blockchain working group to determine a recommended definition for blockchain technology and recommendations for individuals, businesses, and state agencies to use blockchain technology and report to the legislature. Appropriates funds. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD2)

2439.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on CPC with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McDermott, Yamashita excused (2).
2439.title: Relating To Cable Television.
2439.description: Amends the factors the director of commerce and consumer affairs must consider when determining whether cable service should be made available upon a new application of a cable franchise. Requires that the director require cable operators make cable service available to residences in their service area where there is a minimum density of at least twenty-five homes per linear mile, except when service is available from an unspecified number of other cable operators. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2442.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to WAM.
2442.title: Relating To Abandoned And Derelict Vehicles.
2442.description: Establishes the abandoned and derelict vehicles task force to make recommendations to ensure the proper identification and disposal of abandoned and derelict vehicles left on the State's highways. Appropriates moneys. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2444.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on CPC with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McDermott, Saiki excused (2).
2444.title: Relating To Water Rates.
2444.description: Requires the Department of Health to conduct a study on the water rates and water usage rates in counties with a population greater than 500,000. Effective July 1, 2050. (HD1)

2445.title: Relating To Observances.
2445.description: Requires the Legislative Reference Bureau to compile a report of the months and days of the year that have been designated by both chambers of the Legislature as a holiday or a period of recognition or observance within the State. Effective 10/19/2036. (HD1)

2448.title: Relating To Concessions.
2448.description: Provides state and county governments more flexibility and discretion to address substantial hardship situations that impact concession contracts. Effective 1/1/2050. (HD1)

2451.title: Relating To Public Order.
2451.description: Establishes the offense of urinating or defecating in a public place within business districts. Takes effect on 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2453.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Twenty-second Representative District.
2453.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects in the twenty-second representative district.

2459.last_action: The hearing on this measure has been cancelled until further notice.
2459.title: Relating To Social Services.
2459.description: Amends the monthly needs allowance for individuals residing in foster homes, care homes, domiciliary homes, and other long-term care facilities. Amends the state supplemental payment ceiling for domiciliary care paid to recipients who are eligible for federal supplementary security income or public assistance, or both. Takes effect on 12/31/2059. (HD1)

2462.last_action: Referred to HSH, LHE, FIN, referral sheet 5
2462.title: Relating To Aging.
2462.description: Appropriates funding to develop the Charles Atherton House and property into a University of Hawaii kupuna center and support the activities of the University of Hawaii UHealthy Hawaii initiative.

2464.last_action: Referred to AGR/WLH, FIN, referral sheet 5
2464.title: Relating To Agricultural Land.
2464.description: Subject to certain restrictions, allows second dwellings on agricultural lands in a county with an area greater than 4,000 square miles. Takes effect 01/01/2021.

2467.last_action: The committee(s) on LHE recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2467.title: Relating To Early Childhood Education Scholarships.
2467.description: Establishes the early childhood education scholarship program within the University of Hawaii to assist students with school tuition in return for a service commitment to teach in a preschool classroom of the executive office on early learning public prekindergarten program. Appropriates funds.

2472.title: Relating To A Bank Of The State Of Hawaii.
2472.description: Directs the Department of Commerce and Consumer Affairs to conduct a comprehensive review of relevant state laws to develop legislation to establish a state-operated bank of the State of Hawaii. Appropriates funds to conduct the review. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD2)

2473.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Eli, Har excused (2).
2473.title: Relating To Hawaii Housing Finance And Development Corporation.
2473.description: Requires the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation to award funds no later than an unspecified number of days after the deadline to file a consolidated application or no later than an unspecified number of days after the filing of a duly submitted consolidated application if no deadline has been established by the corporation. Takes effect on 7/1/2025. (HD1)

2474.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
2474.title: Relating To The Transition Of The Oahu Regional Health Care System From The Hawaii Health Systems Corporation Into The Department Of Health.
2474.description: Commence the transfer of the Oahu regional health care system in its entirety from the Hawaii health systems corporation to the department of health, beginning with the transfer of the Oahu regional health care system's budget and position count into the department of health. Enable the Oahu regional health care system, department of health, Hawaii health systems corporation, and other state agencies to manage and implement the processes required to effectuate the completion of such transition. Takes effect on 7/1/2050. Part II takes effect on 1/1/2050. (SD1)

2476.last_action: The committee(s) on PVM recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
2476.title: Relating To Food Security.
2476.description: Authorizes the Governor to issue a proclamation of pre-disaster necessity for the purpose of assisting foodbanking organizations to maintain food stocks for an emergency. Appropriates funds. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2479.last_action: The hearing on this measure has been cancelled until further notice.
2479.title: Relating To The State Plan.
2479.description: Establishes green infrastructure objectives and policies for state facility systems in the Hawaii State Planning Act to improve the quality of life for residents and visitors. Adds definition of "green infrastructure". Requires the office of planning, in partnership with the greenhouse gas sequestration task force, to submit a report to the legislature making recommendations for implementing the green infrastructure objectives, policies, and priority guidelines established by this measure. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

2480.last_action: Referred to TRN/EEP, FIN, referral sheet 5
2480.title: Relating To Conservation.
2480.description: Authorizes the issuance of special license plates to support forest conservation and ocean conservation, with proceeds from the program to be used to fund conservation efforts at the State's beaches, nearshore environment, and forests.
