4979.description: Establishes a working group to develop a comprehensive statewide plan for undergrounding utility lines. Appropriates funds.

4981.last_action: The committee on CPH deferred the measure.
4981.title: Relating To The Hawaii State Hospital.
4981.description: Appropriates funds for the renovation and repurposing of the Guensberg building at the Hawaii state hospital for a secure residential co-occurring treatment program.

4986.title: Relating To Estate Tax Inflation Adjustment.
4986.description: Requires Hawaii's estate tax applicable exclusion amount to be calculated by utilizing the federal Internal Revenue Service inflation adjustment mechanism. Applies to decedents dying and taxable transfers occurring after 12/31/2020. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

4994.last_action: The committee on CPH deferred the measure.
4994.title: Relating To Landlord-tenant Law.
4994.description: Allows, at the request of either the tenant or the landlord in any court proceeding in which repair costs of tenant-caused property damage is in dispute and the repair costs exceed the tenant's security deposit, the tenant to deposit the amount of damages claimed into the court, such funds to be distributed consistent with a judgement.

4996.title: Relating To Sports Officials.
4996.description: Allows a court to enjoin a defendant convicted of committing certain assault or terroristic threatening offenses against a sports official from attending any sports event of the type at which the sports official was engaged in the lawful discharge of the sports official's duties. (HD1)

4997.title: Relating To The Cooling Initiative.
4997.description: Appropriates funds for the installation of air conditioning units in Department of Education schools on the island of Hawaii.

4998.title: Relating To Home Ownership.
4998.description: Relocates the Hawaii housing finance and development corporation, the Hawaii public housing authority, and the Hawaii community development authority to one shared facility. Appropriates funds.

4999.title: Relating To A School Supply Subsidy Pilot Program.
4999.description: Establishes and makes an appropriation for a one-year school supply subsidy pilot program at Naalehu elementary school.

5002.last_action: This measure has been deleted from the meeting scheduled on Tuesday 03-17-20 8:30AM in conference room 329.
5002.title: Relating To Ambulances.
5002.description: Appropriates funds to the Department of Health for the purchase of one advanced life support ambulance based in Makalei in the county of Hawaii, and related equipment and personnel costs. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD2)

5015.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Thielen excused (1).
5015.title: Relating To The Mental Health Of Defendants.
5015.description: Authorizes the courts to enter into agreements with the parties where there is reason to believe the defendant has a physical or mental disease, disorder, or defect that will or has become an issue in the criminal case. Requires either one psychiatrist or one psychologist to be appointed in felony cases requiring three examiners. Requires an examination for penal responsibility to be conducted within fifteen days after a finding of fitness to proceed. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

5021.last_action: This measure has been deleted from the meeting scheduled on Monday 03-16-20 2:00PM in conference room 329.
5021.title: Relating To Children's Health.
5021.description: Requires the department of health to establish, implement, and evaluate a statewide program for early identification of, and intervention for, lead poisoning in children. Requires all children be tested for lead poisoning. Requires primary care providers to test children under their care for lead poisoning. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

5029.title: Relating To Aloha Stadium.
5029.description: Requires at least twenty thousand housing units be developed near the rail station nearest to the aloha stadium. Requires a minimum of eighty per cent of those housing units to be priced as affordable.

5033.last_action: This measure has been deleted from the meeting scheduled on Wednesday 03-18-20 11:15AM in conference room 423.
5033.title: Relating To Tour Aircraft.
5033.description: Amends section 261-12 to require tour aircraft operations permit applicants to have aircraft that are outfitted with FAA approved safety devices. Prohibits tour aircraft permit holders from allowing the noise footprint of their aircraft to enter any occupied property. Requires denial of permit or rescission of permit if requirements are not met. (SD1)

5037.title: Relating To The State Historic Preservation Division.
5037.description: Requires the state historic preservation division to use a program comment approach in its duties. Appropriates funds for the state historic preservation division to conduct a study on buildings built between 1945 and 1970 that would be exempted from a program comment process.

5039.last_action: This measure has been deleted from the meeting scheduled on Tuesday 03-17-20 2:00PM in conference room 329.
5039.title: Relating To Utility Transmission Lines.
5039.description: Exempts a public utility from seeking approval from the public utilities commission to place, construct, erect, or build a high-voltage electric transmission system under certain circumstances. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

5043.title: Relating To The Housing Shortage.
5043.description: Amends the definition of "emergency" to include a period of five or more years in which the number of new housing units produced statewide is less than the number of births minus deaths divided by two.

5045.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
5045.title: Relating To Housing Elements.
5045.description: Requires each county to prepare a housing supply plan to plan for projected increases in the State's housing supply to meet housing demands of the respective county, identify and analyze existing and projected housing needs for all income levels, define the term "housing demand" including a ratio of homes to residents to account for latent demand, and identify adequate sites for housing, including rental housing. Appropriates funds for the counties to conduct the required studies. (SD1)

5065.title: Relating To Informal Meetings.
5065.description: Permits county council members to attend informal meetings without limit on the number of county council members in attendance.

5091.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to JDC/WAM.
5091.title: Relating To Agricultural Theft And Vandalism Pilot Project.
5091.description: Appropriates additional funding for the two-year agricultural theft and pilot project pursuant the Act 217, Session Laws of Hawaii (2019).

5123.last_action: The committee on PSM deferred the measure.
5123.title: Relating To A Domestic Violence Offender Registry.
5123.description: Creates a domestic violence offender registry that is maintained by the Attorney General and accessible by the public. Requires covered offenders to register and annually renew their registration for 15 years, or for life if convicted of a class A felony domestic violence offense. Establishes a class C felony offense for failing to register or for providing false information during the registration process. Requires county police chiefs to maintain a local registry of covered offenders and forward this information to the Attorney General.

5128.title: Relating To Community Choice Aggregation.
5128.description: Authorizes a community choice aggregator to aggregate the electrical load of interested electricity customers within its boundaries. Requires the public utilities commission to adopt rules and submit a report to the legislature.

5135.title: Relating To The Interstate Compact Agreement To Phase Out Corporate Giveaways.
5135.description: Enacts and enters into the Interstate Compact Agreement to Phase Out Corporate Giveaways.

5136.last_action: Referred to CPC, FIN, referral sheet 36
5136.title: Relating To The Residential Landlord-tenant Act.
5136.description: Allows a landlord or landlord's agent to charge an application screening fee as part of the applicant screening process for renting residential property. Limits the amount that may be charged for an application screening fee. Requires the landlord or landlord's agent to return any unauthorized fee amounts to the applicant.

5144.title: Relating To Hydrofluorocarbon Refrigerants.
5144.description: Preserves preexisting federal regulations on the use of hydrofluorocarbons in state law by phasing out those compounds in favor of alternatives with lower global warming potential. Establishes a preference in state procurement for products that do not contain hydrofluorocarbons. Directs the Department of Health and the State Energy Office to study how to increase the use of refrigerants with low global warming potential, reduce the use of hydrofluorocarbons, and recommend how to fund, structure, and prioritize a state program that supports the elimination of legacy uses of hydrofluorocarbons.

5149.title: Relating To Offenses Against The Internet.
5149.description: Authorizes a user of a social media platform to bring a cause of action against the social media platform for deleting or censoring the user's speech.

5155.title: Relating To The Psychology Interjurisdictional Compact.
5155.description: Enacts and enters into the Psychology Interjurisdictional Compact to facilitate telehealth and temporary in-person, face-to-face practice of psychology across jurisdictional boundaries.

5157.last_action: The committee on CPH deferred the measure.
5157.title: Relating To Opioids.
5157.description: Requires providers authorized to prescribe opioids to discuss with patients certain risks associated with controlled substances that are opioids prior to issuing initial opioid prescriptions for the treatment of acute pain. Requires providers to include a note acknowledging the discussion of the risks associated with opioids in the patient's medical record.

5159.last_action: This measure has been deleted from the meeting scheduled on Tuesday 03-17-20 11:07AM in conference room 325.
5159.title: Relating To The Fuel Tank Advisory Committee.
5159.description: Requires the fuel tank advisory committee to meet twice within a same calendar year at least six months apart.

5161.last_action: This measure has been deleted from the meeting scheduled on Tuesday 03-17-20 9:00AM in conference room 325.
5161.title: Relating To The Environmental Council.
5161.description: Establishes the environmental council special fund. Dedicates a portion of the environmental response, energy, and food security tax revenue to the environmental council special fund. Appropriates funds to the environmental council special fund from the environmental response revolving fund. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

5167.last_action: The committee(s) on PVM recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
5167.title: Relating To Registration Fees.
5167.description: Reduces the annual vehicle registration fee by fifty per cent for disabled veterans who are fifty per cent or more disabled but less than one hundred per cent disabled. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

5177.last_action: Referred to JUD, FIN , referral sheet 36
5177.title: Relating To Drug Offenses.
5177.description: Establishes a new misdemeanor offense of promoting a dangerous drug in the fourth degree, to include possession of dangerous drugs in amounts under two grams. Limits the class C felony offense of promoting a dangerous drug in the third degree to include possession of dangerous drugs in an amount of two grams or more. Takes effect 8/1/2020. (SD1)

5180.last_action: This measure has been deleted from the meeting scheduled on Tuesday 03-17-20 8:45AM in conference room 309.
5180.title: Relating To The Kalaupapa Memorial.
5180.description: Appropriates funds for the design, plans, and construction of the Kalaupapa memorial. Effective 7/1/2051 (SD1)

5186.title: Relating To Wind Turbines.
5186.description: Requires all wind turbines that are equipped with obstruction lighting and located within five miles of a residential community to be equipped with aircraft detection lighting systems.

5190.title: Relating To Department Of Land And Natural Resources Permit Fees.
5190.description: Prohibits the department of land and natural resources for charging a fee for a permit to use public lands to a non-profit organization if that organization has paid for a permit for the same public land for fifty consecutive years.

5198.last_action: This measure has been deleted from the meeting scheduled on Tuesday 03-17-20 8:30AM in conference room 329.
5198.title: Relating To The Hilo Medical Center.
5198.description: Makes an appropriation for the equipment and construction of a second full-time catheterization laboratory at the Hilo medical center in the Hawaii health systems corporation east Hawaii region. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD2)

5200.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The First Senatorial District.
5200.description: Authorizes issuance of general obligation bonds for capital improvement projects at the Ernest Bowen De Silva Elementary School and the Francis Wong Stadium. Appropriates funds.

5201.last_action: This measure has been deleted from the meeting scheduled on Tuesday 03-17-20 10:40AM in conference room 423.
5201.title: Relating To Waste.
5201.description: Requires cooperative housing corporations and unit owners' associations of high-rise condominium properties to provide at least one waste cooking oil receptacle in an easily accessible location on the property to allow residents to deposit grease and waste cooking oil. (SD1)

5205.last_action: Referred to EEP, FIN , referral sheet 36
5205.title: Relating To Renewable Energy Tax Credits.
5205.description: Increases the cap amount of the renewable energy technologies income tax credit for solar water heating systems installed and placed in service for multi-family residential property. Beginning 1/1/2025, eliminates the renewable energy technologies income tax credit for solar energy systems for which the primary purpose is not to heat water. Preserves the tax credit for solar energy systems installed and placed in service pursuant to a power purchase agreement for commercial properties that was approved by the Public Utilities Commission prior to 12/31/2019. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD2)

5207.last_action: Referred to LHE, FIN , referral sheet 36
5207.title: Relating To The President Of The University Of Hawaii System.
5207.description: Prohibits the President of the University of Hawaii from serving concurrently as a campus chancellor. (SD1)

5323.last_action: This measure has been deleted from the meeting scheduled on Wednesday 03-18-20 8:35AM in conference room 312.
5323.title: Relating To Crimes On Agricultural Lands.
5323.description: Imposes extended terms of imprisonment for certain offenses against property rights committed on agricultural lands. Takes effect 6/18/2050. (SD1)

5333.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to JDC.
5333.title: Relating To Financial Exploitation.
5333.description: Authorizes a civil cause of action by a vulnerable adult for financial exploitation of a vulnerable adult. Allows attorney's fees and costs and punitive damages. Establishes degrees and classes of felonies for financial exploitation of an elderly person or disabled adult. Establishes a presumption of financial exploitation.

5335.last_action: Referred to HSG/HSH, FIN, referral sheet 36
5335.title: Relating To Short-term Rental Assistance.
5335.description: Establishes the short-term rental assistance fund and short-term rental assistance program. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

5372.title: Relating To Motor Vehicle Safety Inspections.
5372.description: Lengthens the time by which a vehicle must have a safety inspection.

5388.last_action: The committee(s) on WLH recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
5388.title: Relating To Partition Actions.
5388.description: Requires commissioners in partition actions to file reports with the court and fully inform all interested parties of any intended applications to be filed with any department, state agency, or county to carry out the partition or division of real property, including water meter permits. Requires commissioners to provide interested parties the right to object to the report and be heard at a hearing. Requires commissioners to file a report with the court including proposed language of any deed of partition or of sale.

5389.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to WAM.
5389.title: Relating To The Supplemental Budget.
5389.description: Appropriates funds for operating expenses of the department of business, economic development, and tourism.

5402.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to JDC.
5402.title: Relating To Traditional Hawaiian Practices.
5402.description: Exempts the traditional and customary practice of kalo farming on kuleana lands by native Hawaiians from the requisite permit for withdrawal, diversion, impoundment, or consumptive use of water. Exempts the traditional and customary practice of kalo farming on kuleana lands by native Hawaiians from the requisite permit for construction or alteration of a stream diversion works.

5405.title: Relating To Public Employees.
5405.description: Amends section 78-32, Hawaii Revised Statutes to require timely reimbursement for travel expenses laid out by public officers and employees.

5414.title: Proposing An Amendment To Article Vi, Section 3 Of The Hawaii State Constitution To Increase The Mandatory Retirement Age For Justices And Judges.
5414.description: Proposes a constitutional amendment to increase the mandatory retirement age for justices and judges from seventy years to eighty years.

5416.last_action: The committee on HRE deferred the measure.
5416.title: Relating To The University Of Hawaii Community College Promise Program.
5416.description: Converts the University of Hawaii Community College Promise Program from a scholarship to a loan program. Makes these loans forgivable if the recipient works in Hawaii for five years after graduation from college. Authorizes the Board of Regents to establish rules regarding the program.

5423.title: Relating To Hemp Production.
5423.description: Authorizes transfers of moneys in the industrial hemp special fund to the Department of Public Safety and the Department of Health to help defray costs associated with enforcement and certification requirements of the industrial hemp pilot program.

5428.last_action: This measure has been deleted from the meeting scheduled on Tuesday 03-17-20 8:30AM in conference room 329.
5428.title: Relating To Offenses Against Health Care Security Professionals.
5428.description: Classifies the offense of assault in the second degree of a health care security professional as a class C felony. Effective January 2, 2050. (SD1)

5435.title: Relating To Renewable Energy Projects.
5435.description: Authorizes the governor, or the governor's designee, to terminate the Na Pua Makani wind energy project. Appropriates funds.

5436.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to JDC/WAM.
5436.title: Relating To Commercial Shark Tours.
5436.description: Prohibits commercial shark tour operations from operating without a permit. Requires the department of land and natural resources to adopt rules to regulate commercial shark tours, including adherence to a code of conduct. (SD1)

5438.title: Relating To Firearm Registration.
5438.description: Requires every person who permanently moves firearms out of the State to contact the county police department where the firearms are registered to notify that police department that the firearms have been moved out of State within five days of their removal from the State. Imposes a fine of $100 per firearm for violations. (HD1)

5447.last_action: Referred to HSG, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 36
5447.title: Proposing An Amendment To Article Ix, Section 5, Of The Constitution Of The State Of Hawaii.
5447.description: Proposes an amendment to article IX, section 5, of the Constitution of the State of Hawaii, to require the State to place housing for its residents among its highest priorities and to implement this provision by statute. (SD1)

5449.title: Relating To Liquor Licenses.
5449.description: Restricts the issuance and renewal of class 11 cabaret liquor licenses to establishments within hotels located in a zoned resort area.

5450.title: Relating To Public Notice.
5450.description: Establishes enhanced public notice requirements for change in land use by the Department of Hawaiian Home Lands, Department of Land and Natural Resources, or the University of Hawaii and boundary changes by the Land Use Commission. Requires approval of the project by the community through a referendum of nearby adult residents except for projects within the Mauna Kea science reserve, which require a referendum by all adult residents of the county in which the Mauna Kea science reserve is located. Appropriates funds.

5451.last_action: Referred to WLH, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 36
5451.title: Relating To Prince Jonah Kuhio Kalanianaole.
5451.description: Requires certain public buildings on Hawaiian home lands to display portraits of Prince Jonah Kuhio Kalanianaole. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD2)

5470.last_action: Referred to LHE, FIN, referral sheet 36
5470.title: Relating To Interscholastic Athletic Associations.
5470.description: Designates the official interscholastic athletic associations for each county in the State. Excludes these interscholastic athletic associations from the standards and conditions related to the receipt of funds contained in Chapter 42F, HRS. Appropriates funds to support the continued operations of the official interscholastic athletic association for each county in the State. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD2)

5471.title: Relating To The Hawaii Public Procurement Code.
5471.description: Requires a construction procurement of less than $50,000 to contract for drilling work and soil testing to be conducted by competitive sealed bidding. Requires the bid request to be advertised to the public on the Department of Accounting and General Services' website. Requires a bid for drilling and soil testing to be separate from a bid for engineering work on the same project.

5494.last_action: Referred to WLH/HSG, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 36
5494.title: Relating To Property.
5494.description: Prohibits nonresident aliens and businesses and trusts that are significantly controlled by nonresident aliens from acquiring certain residential property in the State, except as otherwise provided by law. Effective 12/31/50. (SD1)

5500.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Second Senatorial District.
5500.description: Authorizes issuance of general obligation bonds for capital improvement projects for the Puna reginal library and the Puna agricultural park. Appropriates funds.

5507.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to JDC.
5507.title: Relating To Missing Persons.
5507.description: Creates and implements a silver alert program to alert the public of any missing senior citizen with dementia, to be integrated with the MAILE/AMBER alert program. (SD1)

5510.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Gates, McDermott, Thielen excused (3).
5510.title: Relating To Prisons.
5510.description: Establishes a working group within the department of public safety to study the feasibility of a pilot program to reduce recidivism, focusing on providing inmates with vocational training, in addition to business, entrepreneurial, and financial literacy education. Requires a report to the legislature. Effective 7/1/2050. (HD1)

5517.last_action: The committee on AEN deferred the measure.
5517.title: Relating To Air Freight.
5517.description: Establishes the air freight inspection, quarantine, and eradication service fee and charge and corresponding fund to finance inspection, quarantine, and eradication activities relating to air freight that arrives at the State's airports. Transfers plant quarantine branch employees stationed at airports from the department of agriculture to the department of transportation.

5519.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to WAM.
5519.title: Relating To Environment.
5519.description: Appropriates funds for the Hawaii invasive species council to conduct an albizia prevention pilot project.

5524.title: Relating To The Advice And Consent Of The Senate.
5524.description: Requires nominees for the position of deputy director of principal State departments to go through the process of Senate advice and consent.

5535.last_action: This measure has been deleted from the meeting scheduled on Monday 03-16-20 2:05PM in conference room 325.
5535.title: Relating To Equal Access To Public Conveniences.
5535.description: Requires that restrooms and toilet facilities of public amusement facilities constructed, renovated, retrofitted, or installed after 1/1/2021 have 2 female-use toilets for each male-use toilet or urinal.

5538.last_action: The committee on TRS deferred the measure.
5538.title: Relating To Tour Aircrafts.
5538.description: Requires verification that an applicant for a tour aircraft permit fitted their aircraft with Federal Aviation Administration approved flotation equipment. Requires verification that an applicant for a tour aircraft permit equipped their aircraft with and uses during operation an automatic dependent surveillance-broadcast system. Requires tour aircraft operators to comply with the National Transportation Safety Board safety recommendations. Prohibits any tour aircraft operator from operating an aircraft near a residential property.

5539.title: Relating To Disposition Of Tax Revenues.
5539.description: Establishes the teacher salary special fund. Requires that a portion of general excise tax revenues collected on new construction of commercial real estate projects be deposited into the state highway fund and the teacher salary special fund. Requires that a portion of conveyance tax revenues be deposited into the state highway fund and the teacher salary special fund.

5544.title: Relating To The Right To Privacy.
5544.description: Prohibits businesses from verifying the age of certain purchasers of age-restricted goods.

5545.last_action: The committee on PSM deferred the measure.
5545.title: Relating To Social Infrastructure For Community Problem-solving.
5545.description: Authorizes certain state grant-in-aid recipients to request certain amendments to grants-in-aid contracts during governor-declared states of emergency. Authorizes the governor to release qualified state workers to serve in community-based disaster relief networks during and in anticipation of governor-declared states of emergency. Appropriates moneys.

5548.last_action: Referred to TIA, LAB, FIN, referral sheet 36
5548.title: Relating To The State Surfing Commission.
5548.description: Establishes the State Commission on Surfing within the Hawaii Tourism Authority. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD2)

5549.last_action: The committee on TRS deferred the measure.
5549.title: Relating To Automobiles.
5549.description: Requires passenger vehicles to be tested for emissions as part of the required yearly inspection, excepting those vehicles manufactured prior to 1975 and within the preceding five years.

5554.title: Relating To Election Campaigns.
5554.description: PART I: Adopts the code of fair campaign practices to allow candidates and noncandidates to agree to conduct their campaigns consistent with the code. PART II: Allows for a candidate that obtains the minimum qualifying contribution amount for public funding be eligible to receive payments of $3 for each $1 of qualifying contributions under $10 in excess of minimum qualifying contributions amounts. PART III: Establishes a public participation fee to be paid by noncandidate committees that only make independent expenditures and directs those funds to the partial public financing program. PART IV: Increases spending limits by ten per cent for candidates that voluntarily agree to limit campaign expenditures.

5555.title: Relating To The Green Environment.
5555.description: Adds objectives, policies, and implementation guidelines for planning for the lei of green to the Hawaii State Planning Act.
